ULO1 - complete the required number of days of professional experience and activities specified in the professional experience expectations document ULO2 - document your professional learning through means such as a professional experience folder which records lesson planning, self-reflections and an evaluation on developing practice ULO3 - achieve a satisfactory level of progress in your development as a teacher in line with the activities specified in the professional experience expectations document and the professional experience report.

ULO1 - articulate the aims, rationale, and defining characteristics of the Sport Education model ULO2 - identify, source and utilise relevant academic literature to explain the advantages and challenges associated with applying the Sport Education model in schools ULO3 - demonstrate an understanding of the need for, and nature of, scaffolding within the context of Sport Education ULO4 - plan and teach a unit of work, underpinned by the Sport Education model, which supports learning for students with a diverse range of abilities ULO5 - provide meaningful feedback and assess learning through a range of authentic assessment opportunities ULO6 - evidence your learning throughout the Sport Education season via a portfolio of artefacts collected weekly.

ULO1 - complete the required number of days of professional experience and activities specified in the professional experience expectations document ULO2 - Attain a Beginner standard of proficiency against Standards 1 and 2 of the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers at the Graduate Teacher level and make progress towards Beginner proficiency on all other standards ULO3 - document your professional learning through means such as a professional experience folder which records lesson planning and self-reflections ULO4 - complete an evaluation on your developing practice.

ULO1 - complete the required number of days of professional experience and activities specified in the professional experience expectations document ULO2 - attain at least a Consolidated standard of proficiency against Standards 1 and 2 of the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers at the Graduate Teacher level and maintain or exceed a Beginner standard of proficiency in Standards 3 to 7 ULO3 - document your professional learning through means such as a professional experience folder which records lesson planning and self-reflections ULO4 - complete an evaluation on your developing practice.

UNIT_TITLE: Fieldwork experience in outdoor education and environmental studies 2
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Adapt experiential knowledge and skills in diverse outdoor education contexts ULO2 - Demonstrate skills to review and analyse the learning needs of others in professional practice ULO3 - Complete the required number of days of fieldwork experience and the activities specified in the professional experience guide for this unit ULO4 - Record, through a fieldwork experience logbook, your field-based learning and self-reflections on your developing knowledge and skills in professional practice.

ULO1 - Understand that how people experience literacy and what counts as literacy is shaped in different social, cultural and linguistic contexts ULO2 - Apply theoretical ideas from critical literacy, place literacies and multiliteracies as a means to understand what might count as literacy in different social, cultural and linguistic contexts ULO3 - Gain an appreciation for the importance of oral story telling in a range of different cultures in particular for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples ULO4 - Understand some of the complexities around learning through English when it is an additional language or dialect.

UNIT_TITLE: Numeracy and mathematics for learning and life
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Articulate the distinction between numeracy and mathematics ULO2 - Demonstrate understanding of the difference between mathematics as a key learning area and numeracy as a general learning area ULO3 - Demonstrate awareness of the different sorts of contexts, problems and activities that lead to learners becoming numerate in their personal and civic lives ULO4 - Articulate how your learning experiences in the unit relate to teaching, learning and leadership in primary schools.

UNIT_TITLE: Subject knowledge for teaching: Measurement and geometry
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the concepts, substance and structure of the mathematical content underpinning measurement and geometry in the primary school curriculum ULO2 - Show awareness of how the concepts and structure of primary measurement and geometry relate to the mathematics of secondary schooling and beyond ULO3 - Demonstrate broad knowledge and understanding of the historical and cultural nature of number and operations and how this relates to education of students from diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders ULO4 - Display confidence in posing and solving problems and reasoning in measurement and geometry, thus being a competent and creative mathematics learner who can foster these attributes in your own learners.

ULO1 - Describe theories of motor control and skill acquisition and how these underpin practice ULO2 - Articulate how the body, mind and environment interact in dynamic ways to impact movement outcomes ULO3 - Understand how diverse biological, personal, developmental, social and environmental factors combine to impact skill acquisition across a range of abilities ULO4 - Provide a sound justification for particular approaches that might be used to develop motor control and skill acquisition outcomes in sports coaching and movement contexts ULO5 - Discuss how different experiences might impact skill acquisition and how experience can be understood via different ways of knowing ULO6 - Demonstrate understandings of discipline knowledge through experiencing the practice of movement as both participant and facilitator.

UNIT_TITLE: Applied movement contexts in health and physical education 1
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Use various coaching styles and approaches to plan and deliver movement experiences that are challenging, safe and well structured ULO2 - Integrate performance analysis technology to critique your delivery and participant skills to support participant learning ULO3 - Demonstrate your capacity to incorporate Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander/First People's histories, cultures and languages into sport and games delivery ULO4 - Recognise the ways in which environmental, social, psychological and physiological conditions of participants influence your engagement in movement contexts and respond to these in your own delivery ULO5 - Communicate and display ethical practice in your delivery of movement opportunities.

ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge about and an appreciation for the ways in which  health is experienced and understood by individuals and groups in society ULO2 - Identify and discuss contemporary local, national and international approaches to health promotion ULO3 - Critically evaluate and apply principles, frameworks and practices that underpin effective health promotion planning and evaluation (international and national) ULO4 - Compare and contrast approaches to health and consider their impact upon health and wellbeing of individuals and groups ULO5 - Work collaboratively and cooperatively in a variety of independent and group contexts.

ULO1 - Demonstrate a theoretical understanding of the contribution of outdoor education to personal and social wellbeing ULO2 - Investigate outdoor education contexts and your portrayal using a range of environmental and cultural lenses ULO3 - Conduct a critical review of the potential of outdoor education contexts in relation to specific environments and communities ULO4 - Communicate understanding of social and ecological pressures placed upon outdoor environments via settlement, industry and leisure.

UNIT_TITLE: Fostering positive child and adolescent behaviour and development
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand both childhood and adolescence as periods of diverse individual development, behaviours and relationships in society ULO2 - Understand and apply various approaches to fostering positive interactions in classroom contexts across the school years, including developing a broad range of strategies for involving parents/carers in the educative process to maximise success for students with diverse needs ULO3 - Examine the likely impact of factors such as culture, family, genetic inheritance, environment and life experiences on children and adolescents ULO4 - Analyse a range of learning theories, contemporary theoretical perspectives and practical approaches to fostering positive interactions ULO5 - Identify effective teaching strategies that support positive interactions and enhance learning.

ULO1 - Develop knowledge and understanding of classroom practice including planning for differentiated teaching and learning, meeting diverse learners' needs, behaviour management and innovative practice ULO2 - Identify a range of theoretical perspectives on classroom practice, and critically examine these in light of your own developing practice ULO3 - Demonstrate your understanding of a range of effective and inclusive teaching strategies that meet the needs of students across the full range of abilities ULO4 - Explore and develop your own pedagogical and classroom practice ULO5 - Reflect upon your own practices in relation to effective teaching.

ULO1 - Appreciate science as a way of thinking that generates knowledge (representing cultural and societal dimensions) that is used to describe and respond to our environment ULO2 - Demonstrate an understanding of the ways in which science responds to technological and social change ULO3 - Critically reflect on your experiences as learners of science and identify implications for your professional identities as science educators ULO4 - Identify, develop, plan and deliver appropriate strategies to establish, monitor and develop learners' understanding of science as a way of knowing and the importance of reasoning and critical thinking skills.

ULO1 - Develop and demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the discipline of mathematics including the geometry and measurement, and the probability and statistics strands in the mathematics curriculum ULO2 - Synthesise and apply research findings on effective teaching and learning in mathematics ULO3 - Design a unit of work that includes strategies to promote a range of mathematical proficiencies including understanding, fluency, problem solving and reasoning capacities ULO4 - Use a variety of assessment techniques to evaluate your own mathematical learning and to inform teaching ULO5 - Explain the meaning of numeracy and develop your own numeracy proficiency and data use.

UNIT_TITLE: Understanding behaviour in classrooms and schools
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify factors necessary for creating engaging classrooms for all learners, including those with disabilities ULO2 - Critically examine significant research that can be used by educators to create engaging classroom environments ULO3 - Learn about theories and strategies that can be used to create engaging classrooms for all ULO4 - Understand the need to collaborate with parents and other stakeholders in creating engaging classrooms.

UNIT_TITLE: Learning and teaching for students with diverse needs in various education settings
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically analyse research evidence that supports the use of different learning and teaching practices ULO2 - Identify a range of effective and evidence-based learning and teaching strategies for students with disabilities to support inclusive student participation and engagement in classroom activities ULO3 - Create lesson plans incorporating evidence-based strategies to provide inclusive and personalised learning for diverse learners ULO4 - Develop and practise positive relationship and communication skills between teachers and students ULO5 - Demonstrate understanding of principles of effective planning and reflect upon your own practice.

ULO1 - Recognise the centrality of language and literacy in mediating learning in and out of school and the importance of ties between home and school practices ULO2 - Understand a range of theories that reconceptualise traditional understandings of school and out-of-school literacy and their social, cultural, political and pedagogical implications ULO3 - Understand, develop and apply the relationship between language, learning and identity in analysing your own literacy and numeracy practices in diverse contexts ULO4 - Conduct a small-scale inquiry into literacy and numeracy practices, including those involving information and communication technologies (ICTs), in classrooms, schools and out-of-school settings ULO5 - Understand and appreciate the value of sociocultural diversity in school communities and begin developing a professional capacity to recognise, respond and teach to difference ULO6 - Critically engage with relevant policy and curriculum initiatives and their pedagogical implications.

UNIT_TITLE: Schooling, education and equity: Local and global perspectives
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Interpret a range of education policy developments and educational research that relates to schooling and equity in local, national and global contexts ULO2 - Critically explore the ways in which curriculum and teaching and learning strategies can be ethically responsive to centralised government policy and local and community needs ULO3 - Appreciate the many dimensions and experiences of difference in young people's experiences of schooling in Australia and internationally ULO4 - Demonstrate an understanding of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander histories, cultures and identities and apply this understanding in their work as educators ULO5 - Reflect critically on yourselves as educators and the strategies you will use for engaging diverse learners.

ULO1 - Describe, evaluate and compare different theoretical and practical approaches to developing curriculum, including both traditional and innovative practices ULO2 - Examine contemporary curriculum issues and explore exemplars of innovative practice by teachers in response to these issues ULO3 - Articulate the connections between robust curriculum development and innovative practice ULO4 - Analyse key policies and documents relating to curriculum, including those associated with the Australian Curriculum, and show how they promote or constrain innovative practice ULO5 - Appreciate the importance of teachers as curriculum workers and explain how this is related to their professional identity ULO6 - Develop curricula and practices that are educational, innovative, inclusive of difference and aligned with national and state curriculum policies and frameworks.

ULO1 - Identify and apply key concepts in primary mathematics and numeracy pedagogy ULO2 - Understand how sociocultural, political and educational contexts can facilitate and impede students' learning of primary mathematics and numeracy and how to ensure all children maximise their learning ULO3 - Evaluate personal professional assumptions about teaching and learning primary mathematics and numeracy ULO4 - Plan for the effective use of appropriate pedagogical strategies to support children's learning in current-day, multiple contexts ULO5 - Assess authentically, efficiently and effectively children's mathematics and numeracy learning in formative and summative ways.

UNIT_TITLE: Advanced pedagogy in the primary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate and apply your understanding of varied methods, practices and research in the teaching and learning of disciplines, subjects and learning areas in primary school settings ULO2 - Develop and share examples of lessons and units encompassing differentiated curriculum and individual planning for diverse learner needs ULO3 - Select and use appropriate resources and strategies for the teaching of disciplines, subjects and learning priorities in the primary years ULO4 - Understand and utilise policy, curriculum and research to inform teaching and learning in primary school contexts.

UNIT_TITLE: Advanced pedagogy in the primary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate and apply your understanding of varied methods, practices and research in the teaching and learning of disciplines, subjects and learning areas in the primary school ULO2 - Develop and share examples of lessons and units encompassing differentiated curriculum and individual planning for diverse learner needs in primary schools ULO3 - Select and use appropriate resources and strategies for the teaching of disciplines, subjects and learning priorities in primary schools in varied settings and socio-economic settings within and outside Australia ULO4 - Understand and utilise policy and curriculum from Australia and elsewhere to inform teaching and learning in the primary years.

UNIT_TITLE: Studies of science, environment and sustainability
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Describe and understand the difference between environmental and sustainability education ULO2 - Develop and demonstrate advanced knowledge and understanding of the national and global reasons that have led to the emergence of education for sustainability as an educational priority ULO3 - Develop pedagogical content knowledge necessary to teach education for sustainability and relevant content in the areas of biological, earth and environmental science studies from Foundation to Year 6 in the Victorian Curriculum F-10 and the Australian Curriculum ULO4 - Discuss and evaluate the influence of cultural, social, economic, scientific, ecological and political factors on how concepts of environment and sustainability are understood and incorporated into primary curricula in Australia and internationally ULO5 - Design and implement learning experiences that incorporate environment, sustainability and science at different levels of primary education.

ULO1 - Develop an understanding of children's developmental and individual learning abilities ULO2 - Explain how individual differences can be created by social and other factors ULO3 - Apply knowledge of how to design learning for individual differences in classroom settings ULO4 - Demonstrate the skills required to engage children with emotional, cognitive and behavioural needs in positive learning and developmental experiences ULO5 - Demonstrate an awareness of the skills required to make connections with the home environment and other professional bodies so all children can maximise their capacity to be confident and involved learners ULO6 - Interpret and implement curriculum and legislative requirements that impact on professional practice and planning to meet diverse learner needs.

UNIT_TITLE: Local and global perspectives in education policy
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Research local, national and global contemporary education policies relevant to the field of early years education ULO2 - Critically analyse the effects of local, regional, national and global education policy in early years contexts ULO3 - Develop a critical understanding of policy, and design early years policy documents at service level.

UNIT_TITLE: Children's literature, storytelling and the arts
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Develop knowledge and understanding of English discipline specific content and how to develop personal literacy ULO2 - Develop knowledge of the diversity of genres in children's literature ULO3 - Demonstrate an understanding of effective selection of literature for children of diverse backgrounds and abilities that will promote literacy ULO4 - Show their developing competency in presenting literature and stories to children in a variety of ways that promote oral and written literacy ULO5 - Develop an appreciation of the role literature, storytelling and the arts play in health and wellbeing, sustainability, intercultural communication and Indigenous Australian and Asian people's cultures and perspectives ULO6 - Understand, design and apply varied pedagogical approaches to integrating the study of English language, literature and language arts across the curriculum.

UNIT_TITLE: Change and transition in children's education
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate an in-depth understanding of how to enable children's mobility and agency across experiences of change and transition, so they can be confident, creative and involved learners ULO2 - Research and critically analyse theoretically informed pedagogical strategies to support children through change and transition ULO3 - Demonstrate ability to research traditions, routines and practices of children's life worlds to better understand children's learning and development in diverse and complex contexts ULO4 - Research, critically analyse and develop strategies for ethical, innovative and collaborative work with families and other professionals to support children's learning experiences of change and transition.

ULO1 - explore and apply approaches related to language learning for diverse learners including decoding/encoding codes, symbols and conventions of written, spoken, visual and multimodal texts in response to contextual factors ULO2 - apply strategies for developing children's awareness of key literacy concepts ULO3 - develop plans detailing goals, implementation, and evaluation of children's phonemic awareness, concepts of print, fluency, comprehension and vocabulary development ULO4 - explore and apply approaches related to comprehending and composing written, spoken, visual and multimodal texts ULO5 - understand and apply the various purposes for different written, spoken, visual and multimodal texts and how these texts are used across cultures and diverse contexts ULO6 - understand how to develop children's critical thinking across various texts.

UNIT_TITLE: Investigating our world: Science, technology and the environment
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Develop advanced theoretical knowledge and understanding of how young children learn scientific and technological concepts in everyday contexts ULO2 - Generate and analyse data associated with researching teaching and learning in science and technology ULO3 - Critique a range of pedagogical approaches that support children's learning in science, technology and the environment ULO4 - Recognise that knowledges are culturally constructed and that a range of world views about science, technology and the environment should be supported in programs in the birth to eight years period ULO5 - Develop high-level observational and analytical skills in discerning children's learning of science and technology in everyday learning environments.

ULO1 - Critically analyse the foundational principles of early childhood learning ULO2 - Demonstrate an understanding of contemporary theories of learning that influence children's learning and development ULO3 - Demonstrate capacity to adapt the knowledge of theoretical concepts and analytical skills to a range of learning environments ULO4 - Recognise initiatives in the design of program approaches consistent with the intent of enhancing children's learning and development.

UNIT_TITLE: Professionalism, ethics and interdisciplinary work in education
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - develop the knowledge of policies and processes to enable you to make ethical and professional decisions as an educator and future leader in early years and primary settings ULO2 - understand and be ready to implement legislative requirements informing educators' work ULO3 - understand what an interdisciplinary focus means and how it is implemented ULO4 - promote and foster safe, responsible and ethical forms of communication across a variety of contexts and with a variety of professionals connected to early years and primary settings ULO5 - develop and utilise the skills to work in larger teams of education professionals ULO6 - understand the implications of professionalism and ethics in interdisciplinary work for children, their families and the community.

UNIT_TITLE: Leadership and management in education contexts
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand leadership and management in local and international education settings ULO2 - Critically analyse different approaches to leadership and apply this to a broad range of educational contexts ULO3 - Apply leadership knowledge in working with and establishing policies expected in mandated and current requirements ULO4 - Understand the importance and impact of social, cultural and political factors on leadership roles in educational settings and the implications of these for children's learning ULO5 - Demonstrate an understanding of the challenges of leadership in dynamic educational environments and an ability to make professional and ethical decisions.

ULO1 - apply knowledge and understanding of, and respect for, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, histories, cultures and languages to develop curriculum that promotes reconciliation between Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and non-Indigenous Australians ULO2 - describe the impact of culture, cultural identity and linguistic background on the education of students from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander backgrounds ULO3 - create culturally responsive curriculum that responds to the local communities, cultures, histories, and linguistic backgrounds of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students.

UNIT_TITLE: Inclusive education: Teaching learners with diverse abilities
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - critically analyse your own professional practice to identify and address beliefs, attitudes and practices that exclude and disadvantage some learners from achieving academic success and learning outcomes ULO2 - develop understanding of a range of characteristics and factors including physical, social and intellectual characteristics, gender, language, religion, culture, race, sexual orientation, socio-economic status or disabilities that have an impact on learners' access to, participation in and learning outcomes at school ULO3 - develop personalised learning and support plans to support participation and engagement of all learners, including those with a disability ULO4 - demonstrate understanding of legislative requirements and teaching strategies that support participation and learning of learners with a disability ULO5 - evaluate teaching strategies that support the academic achievement and learning outcomes of all learners.

ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the Geometry and Measurement strand ULO2 - locate and modify a variety of quality mathematics teaching resources ULO3 - synthesise and apply research findings on the effective teaching and learning of mathematics ULO4 - design a unit of work that includes strategies to promote mathematical proficiencies (understanding, fluency, problem solving and reasoning capacities) ULO5 - use well designed questions and tasks to inform teaching ULO6 - construct summative assessments, marking rubrics and marking keys to evaluate childrens learning ULO7 - demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the Probability and Statistics strand ULO8 - represent and interpret data to investigate a topic of interest.

ULO1 - reflect upon and develop your own English and literacy skills as a future classroom practitioner ULO2 - demonstrate an understanding of various theoretical perspectives related to how middle and upper primary children develop their literacy knowledge, skills and understanding ULO3 - explore effective ways to plan, teach and assess learning experiences to develop middle and upper primary children's reading, writing, oral language and new literacies ULO4 - plan inclusive learning experiences that take into account learners from diverse linguistic, cultural, religious and socioeconomic backgrounds.

ULO1 - plan, structure and sequence science learning programs ULO2 - select and use resources to support science teaching and learning ULO3 - develop strategies to develop and improve science teaching programs ULO4 - use conceptual, curriculum and assessment knowledge to organise content into effective science learning and teaching sequences ULO5 - draw from a range of teaching strategies to support science learning.

ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the concepts, substance and structure of the content and teaching strategies of the Technologies learning area ULO2 - develop an effective learning and teaching sequence using digital technologies ULO3 - implement teaching strategies for using ICT to expand curriculum learning opportunities for students ULO4 - demonstrate knowledge of strategies that can be used to evaluate teaching programs to improve student learning ULO5 - demonstrate the capacity to organise classroom activities where learners time is spent on learning tasks ULO6 - demonstrate knowledge of the relevant issues and select appropriate strategies to support the safe, responsible and ethical use of ICT in learning and teaching.

ULO1 - Analyse key policies and documents relating to partnerships including those associated with the Australian Curriculum, and show how they promote or constrain community-based collaborations that accommodate the diverse needs of learners ULO2 - Describe the strategies required to build respectful partnerships with First People's communities ULO3 - Embed First People's histories, cultures and languages within curriculum and pedagogy ULO4 - Evaluate contemporary curriculum approaches that adopt community partnerships to ensure educative value and compliance with a range of regulatory frameworks ULO5 - Critically articulate how schools can promote community-based learning through educative experiences with multiple learning partners, including parents/carers, and community professionals, through face-to-face interactions and the use of information and communication technologies (ICTs) such as social media.

UNIT_TITLE: Leadership, policy and pedagogies in health and physical education
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand theory and policies that relate to school education, including the field of HPE, in order to understand their influence on leadership and change and apply these to their pedagogical practice ULO2 - Demonstrate a high level of competence as knowledgeable, articulate and reflective practitioners, positioned to become future leaders in HPE and education in school and community settings ULO3 - Engage with relevant professions, colleagues and communities to become ethical leaders and practitioners who can critically respond to educational priorities ULO4 - Apply responses to educational priorities that comply with various legislative, administrative and organisational policies and processes ULO5 - Demonstrate understanding of and commitment to network development and continued professional learning to improve HPE practice.

ULO1 - Critically analyse the complex relationship between sociocultural, political, economic and environmental factors and the health status of individuals and communities in Australia and internationally ULO2 - Engage with contemporary and emerging health challenges relating to social justice, equity and ethics in relation to health, health status, youth health and health enhancement for all ULO3 - Explore a variety of key contemporary health issues, information sources and discourses that influence the health status of a diverse range of people in society ULO4 - Collect and analyse relevant media texts which portray and articulate particular details and discourses about the health status of individuals, communities and populations in society ULO5 - Critically examine and design creative and sustainable solutions to an emerging global health challenge ULO6 - Work collaboratively and cooperatively in a variety of group contexts.

UNIT_TITLE: Contemporary approaches to learning for infants and toddlers: Theories and practices
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - critically analyse relevant philosophies to make informed professional and ethical decisions about your own developing infant and toddler pedagogy. ULO2 - research, evaluate and demonstrate how the rights of infants and toddlers can be upheld in ways that are consistent with the declaration of the rights of children. ULO3 - research and evaluate a range of theories that inform infant and toddler learning and development. ULO4 - investigate and analyse learning strategies that encourage emotion, well-being, safety and communication ?which support infant and toddler learning and development. ULO5 - identify and apply infant and toddler pedagogy that can respond professionally and ethically to diverse linguistic, cultural and socio-economic early childhood contexts.

ULO1 - understand the notion of a discipline: concepts, skills/tools and knowledge ULO2 - apply the key principles of disciplinary inquiry teaching and the relationship to inquiry literacy as a teacher attribute ULO3 - articulate the relationship between inquiry literacy and different forms of disciplinary integration (multidisciplinary, interdisciplinary, transdisciplinary) in both primary and secondary contexts ULO4 - evaluate the potential of inquiry teaching for addressing cross-curriculum priorities in the Australian and Victorian Curriculums ULO5 - demonstrate understanding of assessment appropriate to integrated inquiry teaching and learning

ULO1 - display and articulate a sense of self as an educator who demonstrates an equitable understanding, respect, and sensitivity for improving educational practice through partnerships ULO2 - research diverse structures and backgrounds of living, being, and knowing of varying family contexts ULO3 - initiate, lead and implement ethical direction for spontaneous and planned communications to establish collaborative partnerships ULO4 - design innovative systems for partnership communications to be responsive to the learning strengths and needs of children from a range of linguistic, cultural, religious and socioeconomic backgrounds ULO5 - critically analyse case study situations to create community networks for support and resourcing as identified and investigated to solve problems and make decisions ULO6 - identify partnerships and influences for actions of practice and ethical responsibilities through Brofenbrenners ecological systems.

ULO1 - identify the key principles of adapting curriculum for students with disabilities ULO2 - recognise teaching practices that may exclude some students from participating in learning and teaching activities ULO3 - learn about ways curriculum can be adapted across different subject areas, student populations and at different stages of schooling ULO4 - work cooperatively with a range of stakeholders in adapting curriculum.

UNIT_TITLE: Teaching and learning of students needing increased support
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand the professional implications for supporting the wellbeing of learners with disabilities and their future success in a variety of educational settings and across the school years ULO2 - develop skills in using evidence-based approaches for curriculum design and technology to remove barriers for the access, participation and engagement of learners with disabilities ULO3 - identify community and school resources and supports available for learners with disabilities ULO4 - understand the role of, and develop skills to collaborate with, other personnel (including teacher assistants), family members and other professionals when supporting the higher needs of learners with disabilities ULO5 - create evidence-based teaching resources relevant to curriculum design, transition planning, professional collaboration or the use of technology and reflect upon their use using professional practice frameworks.

UNIT_TITLE: Inclusion and diversity in health and physical education
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge of the theoretical concepts of inclusive teaching and how these can be applied to curriculum, pedagogy and assessment in health and physical education. ULO2 - apply knowledge of teaching and learning strategies that encompass differentiated and inclusive approaches for diverse learners in health and physical education, with a focus on supporting full participation of learners with a disability ULO3 - articulate and apply strategies to engage with parents and carers to support approaches to inclusive health and physical education delivery ULO4 - demonstrate knowledge of practical approaches within health and physical education to manage challenging behaviour.

UNIT_TITLE: Health, wellbeing and sustainability in global contexts
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - interpret contemporary research and literature that informs health and education practice and policy at several levels ULO2 - critique policies and practices around 'big issues' and determine their efficacy in terms of health and education outcomes for inclusion and diverse populations ULO3 - engage with and explore a number of contemporary and emerging health and education challenges relating to sustainability such as globalisation, social justice, equity, equality, citizenship and ethics ULO4 - critically examine, design and create sustainable solutions to a contemporary or future emerging global health challenge ULO5 - communicate ideas to others using an appropriate range of verbal and nonverbal communication strategies and collaborative techniques.

ULO1 - identify, explain and deploy correct and accurate health information in relation to a number of contemporary youth health issues ULO2 - critically analyse a variety of digital and other media texts of relevance to the health of young people in contemporary society ULO3 - research, access and evaluate information and resources of relevance to the health of young people ULO4 - apply critical media literacy and health literacy skills as a pedagogical resource in a variety of ways and in a variety of contexts ULO5 - communicate ideas to others using an appropriate range of verbal and nonverbal communication strategies and collaborative techniques

ULO1 - collect and analyse data to determine the major fitness components, the factors that affect them, and energy systems used in a variety of sporting and physical activities ULO2 - consider the needs of the individual and other socio-cultural factors when conducting valid and reliable assessment of fitness using ethical protocols ULO3 - design a training program targeting particular performance/athlete/learner goals ULO4 - creatively and effectively integrate information and communication technologies in evaluating, programing and monitoring training ULO5 - demonstrate familiarity with laboratory and field-based practices associated with evaluation, monitoring and execution of sporting, performance, rehabilitation and health-related exercise ULO6 - critique and challenge a range of practices related to sport and exercise science.

ULO1 - critically examine your personal beliefs, values and experiences about teaching and learning, classroom management, communication and motivation ULO2 - articulate your emerging professional learning, identifying significant change moments ULO3 - describe, evaluate and apply a variety of classroom management and communication strategies in educational contexts ULO4 - identify and apply processes for drawing on a range of theories and principles to create effective learning opportunities for students in a range of contexts ULO5 - outline and apply processes for engaging students in their learning, especially disengaged students.

ULO1 - appreciate adolescence as a discrete period of individual development in our society ULO2 - articulate theories of adolescent development from a scientific viewpoint ULO3 - explain the developmental stages of adolescence ULO4 - understand how teacher-student relationships are influenced by issues of adolescent development ULO5 - identify challenges in teaching adolescents and apply effective teaching strategies to support their learning ULO6 - analyse multidimensional influences on adolescents ULO7 - identify strategies that support adolescents well-being and safety including legislative and policy requirements.

ULO1 - complete the required number of days of professional experience and activities specified in the professional experience expectations document ULO2 - attain at least a Consolidated standard of proficiency against Standards 1 and 2 of the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers at the Graduate Teacher level and maintain or exceed a Beginner standard of proficiency in Standards 3 to 7 ULO3 - document your professional experience through means such as a professional experience folder which records lesson planning and self-reflections ULO4 - Complete an evaluation on your developing practice.

ULO1 - complete the required number of days of professional experience and activities specified in the professional experience expectations document ULO2 - attain a Consolidated standard of proficiency in Standards 1 to 4 and Standard 6 of the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers at the Graduate Teacher level and maintain or exceed a Beginner standard of proficiency in Standards 5 and 7 ULO3 - document your professional learning through means such as a professional experience folder which records lesson planning and self-reflections ULO4 - complete an evaluation on your developing practice.

UNIT_TITLE: Fieldwork experience in outdoor education and environmental studies 3
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Adapt experiential knowledge and skills in diverse outdoor education contexts ULO2 - Develop skills to review and analyse the learning needs of others in professional practice ULO3 - Develop educational planning, programming and evaluation techniques and skills ULO4 - Synthesise theory and practice in outdoor education learning contexts.

ULO1 - understand a range of theories related to becoming literate ULO2 - explore a range of theoretical models related to how we develop reading, writing, oral and visual literacies ULO3 - examine national and international policy initiatives on literacy from an historical perspective ULO4 - develop an understanding of the various theoretical debates surrounding literacy teaching and learning ULO5 - explore how the various policy initiatives and debates surrounding literacy have influenced the ways in which different theoretical ideas are positioned in curriculum and schools today.

ULO1 - Understand your own knowledge and skills in relationship to a range of different models of effective leadership ULO2 - Explore and apply models of peer support such as mentoring and coaching ULO3 - Explore and critique a range of literacy initiatives for their effectiveness in improving literacy outcomes ULO4 - Examine the process and approach to evidence-based practice for strategic planning and leadership to improve literacy outcomes.

UNIT_TITLE: Subject knowledge for teaching: Statistics and probability
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the concepts, substance and structure of the mathematical content underpinning statistics and probability in the primary school curriculum ULO2 - Show awareness of how the concepts and structure of primary statistics and probability relate to the mathematics for secondary schooling and beyond ULO3 - Demonstrate broad knowledge and understanding of the historical, political and cultural nature of statistics and probability, and how these relate to the mathematics education of students from diverse backgrounds, including immigrants and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders ULO4 - Demonstrate confident understanding of discipline content and competency as a creative mathematics learner who can foster these attributes in your own learners ULO5 - Apply knowledge for teaching statistics and probability to practice.

ULO1 - Demonstrate development in your personal skills in primary mathematics and numeracy leadership ULO2 - Demonstrate further understanding of your mathematical and numeracy content knowledge in line with local, national and international curriculum ULO3 - Show increased knowledge of teachers' pedagogical content knowledge in mathematics ULO4 - Evaluate theoretical perspectives on the leadership of educational change ULO5 - Reflect on characteristics of effective mathematics and numeracy professional development.

UNIT_TITLE: Applied movement contexts in health and physical education 2
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand the philosophy and theoretical basis of applied movement contexts ULO2 - Actively demonstrate competencies in practical components ULO3 - Critique a variety of traditional/contemporary pedagogical practices and their associated theories ULO4 - Plan and implement a movement experience unit of work grounded in a relevant theoretical framework.

UNIT_TITLE: Inclusion and diversity in movement contexts
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the concepts of social inclusion/exclusion and their relationship to issues associated with diversity and inclusion ULO2 - Articulate how different dimensions of diversity (gender, ethnicity, disability, sexuality and social class) can impact on young people's experiences of inclusion/exclusion in health and physical education (HPE), sport and physical activity ULO3 - Develop teaching and learning strategies and understandings that encompass differentiated and inclusive approaches for diverse learners in varied sport and physical activity contexts, with a focus on supporting full participation of learners with a disability ULO4 - Engage learners in HPE, sport and physical activity using inclusive delivery that contributes to a more equitable and sustainable world ULO5 - Demonstrate a high level of competence as knowledgeable, articulate and reflective practitioners positioned to become future advocates for equity and inclusion within sport and physical activity.

ULO1 - Demonstrate a critical understanding of the different ways in which culture and nature can be related philosophically and practically, and how these relationships can be challenged, sustained and evaluated ULO2 - Identify how educational-based approaches can contribute to a deeper understanding of outdoor experiences and place attachments ULO3 - Develop creative ways of experiencing and representing relationships between nature and culture through perspectives and settings associated with outdoor education ULO4 - Demonstrate necessary technical skills to conduct an independent place-based inquiry project.

ULO1 - Understand key concepts, issues and theories associated with educating for sustainability ULO2 - Engage learners and communities in education for a more equitable and sustainable world ULO3 - Develop, design and implement a range of eco-pedagogic approaches to education in outdoor environments ULO4 - Evaluate and articulate the efficacy of eco-pedagogic practices.

ULO1 - Develop skills in a range of visual art practices and creative pedagogical approaches that connect art with environment, community and sustainability awareness within local and global contexts ULO2 - Analyse and communicate knowledge about how art relates to community and environment through exploring various cultures (e.g.: Indigenous and Torres Strait Islander, Pacific and Asian cultures) and cultural institutions;? ULO3 - Initiate, design and plan compelling ACE (Art, community and environment) experiences that are based on research and engage learners with diverse backgrounds, ages and abilities;? ULO4 - Select and apply assessment strategies and resources to develop learning and teaching sequences relevant to art, community and environment;? ULO5 - Communicated arts based research through clear presentation, proficient and appropriate writing, cohesive and selective use of images.

ULO1 - Describe and understand the implications for teachers and schools of key Victorian, national and international policies pertaining to ensuring students' wellbeing and safety, social justice, equity and inclusion of students from diverse linguistic, cultural, religious and socio-economic backgrounds. ULO2 - Understand relevant legislative, administrative and organisational policies and processes required for teachers and schools and how these impact on practice ULO3 - Investigate the ways in which a range of policies and priority areas are implemented at school and classroom levels and know how to apply these in practice.

ULO1 - Critically analyse your own professional practice to identify and address beliefs, attitudes and practices that exclude and disadvantage some students (based on their gender, race or learning abilities) from achieving academic success and learning outcomes ULO2 - Develop understanding of a range of characteristics and factors including physical, social and intellectual characteristics, gender, language, religion, culture, race, sexual orientation, socio-economic status or disabilities, that have an impact of students' access to, participation in and learning outcomes at school ULO3 - Identify strategies to support student participation and engagement in classroom activities ULO4 - Demonstrate understanding of legislative requirements and teaching strategies that support participation and learning of students with a disability ULO5 - Evaluate teaching strategies that support the academic achievement and learning outcomes of all students.

UNIT_TITLE: Digital technologies: Teaching, learning and the curriculum
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand and design strategies for the effective integration of digital technologies within teaching, learning and assessment in the curriculum ULO2 - select and use information and communication technologies (ICT) in appropriate and creative ways to plan lessons and engage students in their learning ULO3 - discuss current and emerging trends in digital technologies and the implications for teaching and learning ULO4 - critically evaluate research and practice in digital technology use in the curriculum ULO5 - describe relevant issues and the strategies available to support the safe, responsible and ethical use of ICT in learning and teaching.

ULO1 - Understand the key principles of curriculum theory, assessment and evaluation ULO2 - Develop and apply assessment practices within and across learning areas and subjects in local and national curriculum ULO3 - Demonstrate understanding of assessment strategies including informal and formal, diagnostic (including the use and analysis of multiple forms data), formative and summative approaches, as well as the principles of assessment moderation and its application to assessing student learning ULO4 - Demonstrate broad knowledge of assessment and evaluation strategies that can be used to evaluate teaching programs to improve student learning ULO5 - Demonstrate an understanding of the purpose of providing timely and appropriate feedback and reporting to students and parents using accurate and reliable records of student achievement.

ULO1 - Utilise the connections between home, community and school literacy practices for the teaching and learning of English and literacy ULO2 - Demonstrate a critical understanding of key theoretical and practical teaching approaches related to young children's language and literacy development ULO3 - Develop and demonstrate application of a range of effective literacy pedagogical and assessment practices to meet the primary school English curriculum outcomes in the early and middle years of school ULO4 - Plan literacy lesson sequences to address specific learner needs ULO5 - Use a range of information and communication technologies (ICTs) in accessing relevant research literature, to support learning and in presenting evidence of your own learning in the area of literacy.

ULO1 - Identify the key principles of adapting curriculum for students with disabilities ULO2 - Recognise teaching practices that may exclude some students from participating in learning and teaching activities ULO3 - Learn about ways curriculum can be adapted across different subject areas, student populations and at different stages of schooling ULO4 - Work cooperatively with a range of stakeholders in adapting curriculum.

UNIT_TITLE: Teaching and learning of students needing increased support
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand the professional implications for supporting the wellbeing of learners with disabilities and their future success in a variety of educational settings and across the school years ULO2 - Develop skills in using evidence-based approaches for curriculum design and technology to remove barriers for the access, participation and engagement of learners with disabilities ULO3 - Identify community and school resources and supports available for learners with disabilities ULO4 - Understand the role of, and develop skills to collaborate with, other personnel (including teacher assistants), family members and other professionals when supporting the higher needs of learners with disabilities ULO5 - Create evidence-based teaching resources relevant to curriculum design, transition planning, professional collaboration or the use of technology and reflect upon their use using professional practice frameworks.

ULO1 - understand the ways curriculum can be viewed from each of the system, school and classroom levels ULO2 - understand how local and national curricula link with policy documents and how these position teachers and teachers' work ULO3 - inquire into various curricula, assessment and reporting practices to determine their educative value ULO4 - appreciate the complexities and challenges of designing assessment that is valid, reliable and compatible with policies relating to teaching and learning ULO5 - identify and critically reflect on the values, ethics and political dimensions of all curricula and assessment practices ULO6 - articulate your developing beliefs about curriculum, policy and assessment and compare these with theories found in professional literature ULO7 - apply a range of methods to generate evidence of student learning, including innovative application of information and communication technologies (ICTs) ULO8 - appreciate the dilemmas and complexities in reporting to different audiences in ways that can support and enhance student learning.

ULO1 - Develop and document evidence of the impact of your teaching practice on the learning outcomes of the students you teach ULO2 - Document and provide evidence of your professional practice against achievement of the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers at the Graduate level ULO3 - Evaluate and reflect on your knowledge and skills as professionals and identify areas for future professional learning

ULO1 - critically reflect upon and further develop your English and literacy skills (verbally, in written form, and via a range of ICTs) ULO2 - demonstrate your understandings of a range of theoretical perspectives related to how children learn and develop literacy knowledge, skills and understandings throughout the primary school years (especially the upper years) ULO3 - demonstrate your understandings that texts are multimodal in nature, and that engaging with and creating texts involves an understanding of how the different modes integrate to make meaning ULO4 - plan inclusive learning experiences that take into account students who come from diverse social, cultural and linguistic backgrounds ULO5 - explore ways to integrate literacy teaching and learning across the curriculum plan, teach and assess learning experiences to develop middle and upper primary children's reading, writing, oral language and visual literacies.

UNIT_TITLE: Humanities and social education in the primary years
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand and evaluate how the humanities and social sciences, and the broader social education curriculum is structured within the Australian Curriculum and the Victorian Curriculum F-10 ULO2 - Develop expert knowledge and understanding of different theoretical and pedagogical approaches in the humanities and social education curriculum, including disciplinary, interdisciplinary and integrated approaches ULO3 - Design and implement primary lessons and units of work using discipline-based or integrated approaches ULO4 - Locate, evaluate and use a variety of appropriate teaching resources and educational providers that support the teaching of humanities and social sciences and social education in the primary years.

UNIT_TITLE: Science and technology education in the primary years
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand advanced theoretical and pedagogical concepts associated with the teaching of science and technology to children ULO2 - translate conceptual ideas and processes about science into classroom learning activities for children that are appropriate for a range of year levels, areas of science and cultural knowledge associated with science learning ULO3 - research and develop understandings of the variety of science and technology curricula and assessment techniques available for planning and evaluating student learning in science and technology ULO4 - explore ways of stimulating and enriching children's natural curiosity by presenting a broad range of learning experiences ULO5 - reflecting on your past and present science and technology education experiences, develop through the exploration and experience of a variety of learning and teaching strategies a personal approach to teaching science and technology.

UNIT_TITLE: Health and physical education for wellbeing in the primary curriculum
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand and apply content knowledge and concepts related to HPE eg. social and emotional wellbeing, sexuality education, relationships education, mental health, safety ULO2 - identify and apply appropriate resources to guide HPE practice ULO3 - interpret and apply curriculum materials that reflect key appropriate inclusive cultural practices ULO4 - experience, understand and utilise a variety of movement specific pedagogies ULO5 - critically analyse health/wellbeing, physical culture and HPE curriculum and practice

UNIT_TITLE: Arts education in the primary years
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate an understanding of effective planning and teaching of the arts for primary school children of diverse backgrounds and abilities ULO2 - Develop arts lessons that include a focus on integrating the arts with the curriculum and develop assessment strategies for the arts ULO3 - Explore and develop your own arts skills and creative pedagogical practices in the arts ULO4 - Identify, evaluate and interpret a range of relevant curriculum documents and resources for teaching the arts ULO5 - Demonstrate an understanding of the connections between the arts, sustainability, health and wellbeing, interculturality, information and communication technologies (ICTs), and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, Oceanic and Asian contexts.

UNIT_TITLE: Innovation in curriculum and pedagogy in schools
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Describe, evaluate and compare different theoretical and practical approaches to developing curriculum, including traditional and innovative practices ULO2 - Utilise research literature to examine contemporary curriculum issues and explore exemplars of innovative practice in response to these issues ULO3 - Articulate the connections between robust curriculum development and innovative practice ULO4 - Analyse key policies and documents relating to curriculum, including the Victorian Curriculum F-10 and the Australian Curriculum, and show how they promote or constrain innovative practice ULO5 - Appreciate the importance of teachers as curriculum workers and explain how this is related to your professional identity ULO6 - Develop and demonstrate use of innovative practices including ICTs.

ULO1 - demonstrate critical understanding of the local and Australian curriculum for the primary years and the fundamental importance of mathematical reasoning ULO2 - gain an advanced understanding of thinking mathematically and its implications for teaching ULO3 - develop varying strategies and skills for researching, analysing and developing effective pedagogical approaches towards problem solving and investigations ULO4 - engage in deep reflection on your personal and professional learning ULO5 - research, understand and implement varying classroom strategies that link mathematics to practical applications and problems ULO6 - develop techniques for inclusive practices and understand the importance of adopting inclusive practices in relation to the teaching and learning of mathematics.

ULO1 - complete the required number of days of professional experience and activities specified in the professional experience expectations document ULO2 - attain Graduate proficiency in Standards 1 and 5 of the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers at the Graduate Teacher level and maintain or exceed a Consolidated standard of proficiency in Standards 2, 3, 4, 6 and 7 ULO3 - document your professional learning through means such as a professional experience folder which records lesson planning and self-reflections ULO4 - complete an evaluation on your developing practice.

ULO1 - demonstrate a comprehensive and diverse understanding of leadership approaches that have been and are currently used in early childhood and school settings and how this has impacted upon multiple understandings of quality ULO2 - think critically in relation to the impact of effective leadership and the power that exists within relationships, including First Nations approaches of spiritual awareness and worldliness that extend beyond ideas of power ULO3 - apply a range of theoretical perspectives to leadership and the various approaches that are used to lead and empower all in a transformative manner ULO4 - investigate, analyse and evaluate the effectiveness of various local, global and national policy initiatives relating to leadership in education settings, including National Quality Standards (NQS), the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers (APST) and Quality Assurance processes ULO5 - be cognisant of the presence of multiple perspectives through the exploration of notions of subjectivities and how leadership can support stronger reflexive practices with children, families, colleagues and communities ULO6 - articulate and demonstrate an ability to critically engage with quality and how reflexive leaders can lead education programs with children, families and communities as a team.

UNIT_TITLE: Continuity of learning: Transitions and change
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate an ability to research, interpret and critically evaluate research traditions informing the concept of transition and change in early childhood education ULO2 - demonstrate deep disciplinary knowledge of research-informed pedagogical strategies and skills that support transitions and change for children and families ULO3 - demonstrate an ability to engage both professionally and ethically with the complexities of transitions and change for children and families from diverse social, economic, cultural and linguistic backgrounds ULO4 - articulate competently current pedagogical approaches to transitions and change and use this knowledge to identify and articulate your ongoing professional learning needs in this area ULO5 - demonstrate leadership in professional understandings about transition as an opportunity for complex learning.

UNIT_TITLE: Policy and politics in early childhood
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - research, interpret and evaluate the policy context governing early childhood education and care ULO2 - understand, design and implement relevant curriculum frameworks and pedagogies which reflect early childhood policy directions and initiatives ULO3 - critically analyse and interpret policy in practice to ensure policy implementation addresses cultural, social and economic factors influencing the lives of children, families and communities ULO4 - research, interpret and evaluate ways in which early childhood policy directions reflect and influence key trends shaping the profession and its community ULO5 - articulate and demonstrate your professional values and commitment to advocating for the profession through key policy drivers as a means to secure social justice and sustainable futures for children and the profession.

ULO1 - critically analyse health and physical education curriculum and practice ULO2 - demonstrate the capacity to use curriculum, assessment and reporting knowledge to design learning sequences and lesson plans that are developmentally appropriate for primary years ULO3 - understand and utilise a variety of physical education specific pedagogies such as fundamental motor skills, sport education, thematics and game-centred approaches, that promote physically educative experiences ULO4 - understand and apply concepts and information about health and wellbeing education such as emotional and social health, drug education, and sexuality education ULO5 - identify strategies that support the engagement of diverse learners in health and physical education.

ULO1 - take a critical position with respect to scholarly concepts in creative arts education ULO2 - actively demonstrate competencies in practical and creative components of one or more of the specific creative arts disciplines as they apply to teaching and learning ULO3 - critically interpret and understand the place of the creative arts content and pedagogy within the wider primary curriculum ULO4 - adopt a reflective approach and effectively enact a range of inclusive planning, performing, sharing and teaching strategies to demonstrate understanding of The Arts curriculum documents ULO5 - apply sound judgement in selecting and creating appropriate arts activities to meet the diverse needs of students in primary schools ULO6 - demonstrate the ability to adapt as a practitioner according to different context specific situations and in response to reflections on own and others practice.

ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge of the Humanities and Social Sciences (HASS) curriculum area, especially comparative and unique concepts and skills within Geography, History, Economics and Business, Civics and Citizenship ULO2 - understand how primary school learners develop knowledge, skills and understandings in HASS ULO3 - develop appropriate techniques and teaching strategies for engaging primary school learners in HASS learning including inquiry based approaches ULO4 - devise, interpret and critically reflect on units of work in primary HASS incorporating single-disciplinary and integrated disciplinary approaches as well as a range of resources ULO5 - communicate succinctly and clearly HASS information and ideas to others.

UNIT_TITLE: Physical activity and sport in society

ULO1 - Demonstrate your capacity to generate data ethically and analyse its significance ULO2 - Develop, conduct and report on a small-scale project on a professional practice-related topic ULO3 - Demonstrate a clear and coherent exposition of the knowledge you have gained in written and oral forms ULO4 - Reflect on how educational research supports professional learning and practice development, including your own.

ULO1 - articulate how historical interpretations and applications of sport and exercise science knowledge have been critiqued, challenged and reinterpreted ULO2 - understand and interpret fundamental research approaches that underpin the discipline of sport and exercise science ULO3 - work independently and collaboratively to demonstrate competencies in addressing complex problems through interpretation, planning and design of performance based outcomes ULO4 - use and creatively integrate information and communication technologies to articulate understandings of sport and exercise science ULO5 - demonstrate familiarity with laboratory and field-based practices associated with the monitoring and execution of sporting, performance, rehabilitation and health-related practices.

ULO1 - Examine your beliefs about giftedness and gifted behaviour and critique these in relation to research findings ULO2 - Identify issues and practices associated with identification of and provision for gifted students ULO3 - Reflect on and evaluate the theory and practice relating to pedagogical and organisational strategies associated with the field of gifted education ULO4 - Interpret and utilise models used in a range of national and international settings to cater for gifted students ULO5 - Explore and develop differentiated instructional strategies and curricula which challenge a range of abilities and are suitable for mainstream classrooms.

ULO1 - Critically consider the underlying principles of positive psychology. ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge of the implications of development and psychosocial issues on wellbeing across the lifespan ULO2 - demonstrate the skills necessary to select and critically appraise psychological interventions for improved wellbeing across the lifespan ULO3 - appreciate the value of informed group discussion in evaluating psychological research and interventions ULO4 - demonstrate well developed oral and written communication skills

ULO1 - understand the purpose of legislation relating to the practice of psychology and how to comply with such legislation and appreciate the role of ethics in maintaining the integrity and cohesiveness of the profession ULO2 - become familiar with the ethical principles to be adhered to in psychological practice ULO3 - understand the psychologist's responsibilities in relation to clients ULO4 - develop an appreciation of appropriate professional behaviour in a number of potentially complex situations ULO5 - develop decision-making strategies to assist in the maintenance of ethical conduct.

ULO1 - appreciate the role of scientific research in the field of psychology ULO2 - describe, apply and evaluate the different research methods used by psychologists ULO3 - describe the strategies and processes involved in program evaluation ULO4 - understand how to evaluate the validity of research conclusions ULO5 - collect, analyse and interpret data related to your independent research project ULO6 - correctly apply the appropriate statistical methods for designs commonly encountered in psychological research ULO7 - identify ethical issues that can arise in research in psychology and how these are to be addressed ULO8 - use an appropriate statistical package for analysing research data, such as the Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS) ULO9 - produce an assessable research project in a format consistent with the specifications of the Publication Manual of the American Psychological Association (APA) ULO10 - produce a literature review to an acceptable standard on the topic of your research.

UNIT_TITLE: Investigating education issues in global contexts

UNIT_TITLE: Introduction to ethics and professional issues in counselling

ULO1 - Understand theories of diversity, inclusion and exclusion as these influence the creation of caring, purposeful and democratic societies ULO2 - Evaluate the assumptions and metaphors associated with inclusion, e.g. 'safe' classroom, 'level playing field' ULO3 - Recognise the historical and contemporary experiences of cultural, linguistic and socially diverse minority groups ULO4 - Identify the policies and legislative requirements which support diversity, inclusion and participation ULO5 - Understand curriculum aspects and teaching approaches to support inclusive learning for differentiated educational settings and students with additional needs ULO6 - Apply the principles of inclusion in planning, goal setting and design to improve learning engagement across diverse student groups and contexts ULO7 - Build a repertoire of positive learning practices to manage classrooms and/or student behaviour within educational settings ULO8 - Consider how digital technologies may promote inclusion in the learning environment.

ULO1 - Understand how numeracy and mathematics are interrelated ULO2 - Identify the numeracy demands within discipline areas, across the curriculum, and in the school as a workplace ULO3 - Identify the numeracy demands of everyday life across families, cultures, workplaces, and educational settings ULO4 - Develop appropriate learning tasks for students that address the numeracy challenges embedded in the curriculum ULO5 - Interpret statistical and other numerical data to improve teaching and learning ULO6 - Use digital and other tools effectively to engage with curricular and workplace numeracy ULO7 - Demonstrate personal numeracy competencies to meet curricular and workplace numeracy demands.

ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of curriculum (e.g. as enacted, actual, hidden, take-home, contested) ULO2 - Examine the ways in which data informs learning and planning, feeding back and forward into learning ULO3 - Identify the relationships between curriculum, assessment and reporting ULO4 - Evaluate how social, cultural and political contexts shape curriculum, with particular attention to how Indigenous knowledge and values underpin design, assessment and reporting ULO5 - Demonstrate understanding of how policies and legislative requirements intersect and inform curriculum development learning and assessment ULO6 - Apply knowledge and understanding in the planning, implementation or evaluation of a lesson or learning program.

ULO1 - Critically analyse evidence of the impact of your teaching practice on the learning outcomes of the students you teach ULO2 - Document and reflect on evidence of your professional practice against achievement of the Australian Professional Standards for Teaching at the Graduate level ULO3 - Evaluate your professional knowledge and understanding to identify and plan for areas of future professional learning

UNIT_TITLE: Science, technology and sustainability in early years
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand how young children learn scientific and technological concepts in everyday contexts with a focus on sustainability ULO2 - engage with current research about teaching and learning in science, technology and sustainability ULO3 - recognise the cultural nature of knowledge and a range of world views about science, technology and the environment in programs conducted during the period from birth to eight years of age ULO4 - evaluate a range of pedagogical approaches that support children's learning in science, technology and sustainability ULO5 - demonstrate high-level observational and analytical skills in examining children's learning of science and technology in everyday environments.

ULO1 - understand the importance of play as a pedagogical construct ULO2 - critically analyse contemporary theories of play and how these connect to your everyday work with children ULO3 - investigate the social construction of play in a range of cross-cultural contexts ULO4 - observe children's play and identify connections with contemporary theories of play ULO5 - creatively explore the principles of play as a construct for learning in schools, centres and homes.

ULO1 - Understand the ways in which policy directions reflect key trends shaping society in Australia and globally ULO2 - Understand, design and implement relevant curriculum frameworks and pedagogies which reflect early childhood policy directions and initiatives and respond to children in Australian and international contexts ULO3 - Develop teaching and learning strategies that widen participation and inclusion of children to enhance their individual and social prospects ULO4 - Articulate and demonstrate your professional values and commitment to education as a means to secure social justice and sustainable futures for children.

UNIT_TITLE: Early years wellbeing and workplace safety
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate advanced skills in designing and implementing teaching and learning strategies to promote children's wellbeing ULO2 - Critically analyse and evaluate workplace issues of safety and wellbeing, demonstrating initiative, independent thinking and the ability to work collaboratively with other professionals ULO3 - Understand and manage workplace safety within early years settings adhering to regulatory frameworks ULO4 - Demonstrate an understanding of the relative legislative, administrative and organisational policies and processes relevant to early years settings.

UNIT_TITLE: Science education in the primary years
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Appreciate science as a way of thinking and acting that generates knowledge and which represents cultures and societies ULO2 - Demonstrate an understanding for the ways in which science responds to changing technological and social change ULO3 - Critically reflect on your experiences as science learners and identify implications for your professional identities ULO4 - Develop strategies to establish, monitor and develop student understanding of science and the importance of evidence, reasoning and critical thinking skills in this knowledge development ULO5 - Communicate science understanding in multiple ways and to multiple audiences.

UNIT_TITLE: Humanities and social sciences education in the primary years
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand how students learn and develop knowledge, skills and understanding in the humanities and social sciences ULO2 - Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the comparative concepts, structure of content and diversity of teaching strategies ULO3 - Plan lesson sequences in the humanities and social sciences, using knowledge of student learning, content and effective teaching strategies, and a range of resources ULO4 - Demonstrate the capacity to monitor, assess and interpret student learning in ways that acknowledge and engage with diversity using a variety of assessment methods, and modify teaching practices appropriately ULO5 - Develop understanding of democratic practice and equity within communities ULO6 - Show sociocultural awareness and positive views of students from diverse backgrounds ULO7 - Understand the ways in which different perspectives and cross-cultural understandings influence and shape communities and schools ULO8 - Understand the range of cultural experiences within Australian and global communities and the ways in which many cultures have changed the nature of Australian society.

UNIT_TITLE: Arts and design education in the primary years
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate critical understanding of recent trends and curriculum in arts and design education within Australia and internationally ULO2 - Plan and implement learning experiences that focus on the arts and design which cater for children of diverse backgrounds and abilities and which model a range of effective and inclusive teaching strategies ULO3 - Develop units of work that include a focus on integrating the arts and design across the curriculum including demonstrating connections between the arts, design, literacies and information and communication technologies (ICTs) ULO4 - Explore and develop your own arts and design skills and pedagogical practices in the arts and design ULO5 - Identify, evaluate and interpret a range of relevant curriculum documents and resources for teaching the arts and design ULO6 - Apply a variety of assessment approaches in the arts and design.

UNIT_TITLE: Health and physical education in the primary years
