UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate critical understanding of recent trends and curriculum in physical education, health and wellbeing across educational environments both within Australia and internationally ULO2 - plan and implement learning experiences that focus on movement, environment and community in outdoor and indoor settings, and which cater for children of diverse backgrounds and abilities and draw on a range of effective and inclusive teaching strategies ULO3 - explore and develop strategies for health and wellbeing for your future within the teaching profession ULO4 - identify, evaluate and interpret a range of relevant curriculum documents and resources for teaching health and wellbeing ULO5 - apply a variety of assessment approaches in health and physical education ULO6 - identify and work with the concept of community and community-based resources for the development of educational sustainability.

UNIT_TITLE: Arts, design and health education in the primary years
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate a critical understanding of contemporary issues and curriculum in arts, design, health and physical education within Australia and internationally ULO2 - Plan and implement learning experiences that focus on the arts, design, health and physical education which cater for children of diverse backgrounds and abilities and draw on a range of effective and inclusive teaching strategies ULO3 - Develop units of work that include a focus on integrating the arts, design, health and physical education across the curriculum including connections between literacies and information and communication technologies ULO4 - Explore and develop your own skills and pedagogical practices in the arts, design, health and physical education ULO5 - Identify, evaluate and interpret a range of relevant curriculum documents and resources for teaching the arts, design, health and physical education ULO6 - Apply a variety of assessment approaches in the arts, design, health and physical education.

UNIT_TITLE: Navigating youth transitions: Learning, work, and identity
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - recognise how global trends and local contexts affect young people's learning, work, identities and well-being in school and beyond ULO2 - appreciate the challenges and issues facing young people as they navigate complex transitions through schooling levels, from school to work, tertiary education and adulthood ULO3 - access and critically evaluate relevant policy and research relating to youth transitions through post-compulsory education and training, including pathways, employability and lifelong learning ULO4 - consider the diverse needs and identities of young people in transition and assess implications for the purposes and priorities of schools, and the professional roles and practices of teachers ULO5 - design targeted educational programs that address issues facing young people, and support and enhance their transitions through post-compulsory education and training.

ULO1 - appreciate a range of constructions of adolescence: biological, psychological, sociological, educational, and how these have an impact on our understanding of the concept ULO2 - build understanding of Western and cross-cultural adolescent identities and diversity, particularly in terms of ways that ethnicity, socioeconomic status, gender and sexuality have an impact on adolescence ULO3 - become familiar with key policy documents and theoretical perspectives influencing adolescent learning ULO4 - implement and reflect on pedagogical approaches which engage and challenge adolescent learners ULO5 - create a supportive learning environment that focuses on adolescent wellbeing ULO6 - demonstrate the ability to create differentiated curriculum for middle years learners ULO7 - use popular culture or digital technologies and texts to extend and enhance effective middle years learning.

UNIT_TITLE: Accounting education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge of relevant discipline areas associated with the teaching and learning of accounting and related subjects across Years 7 to 12 ULO2 - research, select and evaluate appropriate teaching and learning resources for accounting and related studies ULO3 - set clear, challenging and achievable goals for students in their learning of accounting and associated studies ULO4 - research and design innovative teaching and learning procedures to engage and motivate the diverse range of learners in every classroom ULO5 - demonstrate a capacity to draw on a range of teaching approaches, including the use of information and communication technologies (ICTs), in ways that align with pedagogical intentions ULO6 - employ accountable and theoretically grounded processes to monitor student learning and progress ULO7 - critically evaluate your practicum experiences of teaching accounting and related studies in schools and other settings.

UNIT_TITLE: Accounting education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge of relevant discipline areas associated with the teaching and learning of accounting and related studies across Years 7 to 12 ULO2 - Research, select and evaluate appropriate teaching and learning resources for accounting and related studies ULO3 - Set clear, challenging and achievable goals for students in their learning of accounting and related studies ULO4 - Research and design innovative teaching and learning procedures and plans to engage and motivate the diverse range of learners in every classroom ULO5 - Demonstrate a capacity to draw on a range of teaching approaches, including the use of information and communication technologies (ICTs), in ways that align with pedagogical intentions ULO6 - Create assessment tasks that are purposeful and relevant to the teaching and learning accounting program and the learning needs of students ULO7 - Employ accountable and theoretically grounded processes to monitor and assess student learning and progress ULO8 - Critically evaluate your practicum experiences of teaching accounting and related studies in schools and other settings.

UNIT_TITLE: Biology education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - articulate and apply your understanding of a constructivist perspective of learning in biology ULO2 - link the everyday world of the learner with biology in ways that are meaningful and relevant ULO3 - actively participate in professional conversations about the key theoretical and pedagogical perspectives and issues in teaching biology ULO4 - plan for, enact and adjust as appropriate a variety of teaching and learning strategies and practices to meet the needs of a diverse range of student learners, in a variety of settings and curriculum contexts ULO5 - demonstrate an awareness of the ways in which science education research helps inform teacher practice to enhance student understanding of biological concepts.

UNIT_TITLE: Biology education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate confidence and skill in generating solutions to complex problems in relation to teaching and learning ULO2 - Devise and implement a variety of assessment procedures to promote student learning in biology ULO3 - Plan and implement fieldwork for students that is linked to senior biology curriculum requirements and informed by the research literature ULO4 - Engage in critical reflection as a professional teacher and understand contemporary trends in practice and research at the national and international level ULO5 - Demonstrate a degree of autonomy and adaptability as a responsible professional practitioner.

UNIT_TITLE: Business management education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge of relevant discipline areas associated with the teaching and learning of business management and related studies across Years 7 to 12 ULO2 - research, select and evaluate appropriate teaching and learning resources for business management and related studies ULO3 - set clear, challenging and achievable goals for students in their learning of business management and related studies ULO4 - research and design innovative teaching and learning procedures to engage and motivate the diverse range of learners in every classroom ULO5 - demonstrate a capacity to draw on a range of teaching approaches, including the use of information and communication technologies (ICTs), in ways that align with pedagogical intentions ULO6 - employ accountable and theoretically grounded processes to monitor student learning and progress ULO7 - critically evaluate your practicum experiences of teaching business management and related studies in schools and other settings.

UNIT_TITLE: Business management education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge of relevant discipline areas associated with the teaching and learning of business management and related studies across Years 7 to 12 ULO2 - Research, select and evaluate appropriate teaching and learning resources for business management and related studies ULO3 - Set clear, challenging and achievable goals for students in their learning of business management and related studies ULO4 - Research and design innovative teaching and learning procedures to engage and motivate the diverse range of learners in every classroom ULO5 - Demonstrate a capacity to draw on a range of teaching approaches, including the use of information and communication technologies (ICT), in ways that align with pedagogical intentions ULO6 - Create assessment tasks that are purposeful and relevant to the teaching and learning program and the learning needs of students ULO7 - Employ accountable and theoretically grounded processes to monitor and assess student learning and progress ULO8 - Critically evaluate your practicum experiences of teaching business management and related studies in schools and other settings.

UNIT_TITLE: Chemistry education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand appropriate chemistry content for Years 7 to 12 that takes into account the intelligibility, plausibility and fruitfulness of this content ULO2 - apply contexts for the teaching of chemistry content that accounts for the experiences and social and cultural backgrounds of your clientele ULO3 - evaluate a range of teaching strategies and support resources (human and material) for teaching chemistry ULO4 - select and apply a coherent range of teaching procedures appropriate to fostering motivation and purposeful, independent learning in your students ULO5 - critically understand the principles of curriculum design, the content of current curriculum and the pedagogy of chemistry education ULO6 - develop an evolving philosophy for what chemistry teaching means ULO7 - develop an understanding of the relationship between science, technology and society and the cultural context for chemistry ULO8 - demonstrate critical awareness and understanding of the barriers raised by traditional science and chemistry curricula ULO9 - value the practice of real-world chemistry ULO10 - develop as professionals that are knowledgeable, skilful, flexible and compassionate in your practice and are guided by a sense of social and ethical responsibility.

UNIT_TITLE: Chemistry education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply appropriate chemistry content for Years 7 to 12 that takes into account the intelligibility, plausibility and fruitfulness of this content ULO2 - Use appropriate contexts for the teaching of chemistry content that accounts for the experiences and social and cultural backgrounds of your clientele ULO3 - Evaluate and select teaching strategies and support resources (human and material) appropriate for teaching chemistry ULO4 - Synthesise and apply a coherent range of teaching procedures that foster motivation and purposeful, independent learning in your students ULO5 - Critically understand the principles of curriculum design, the content of current curriculum and the pedagogy of chemistry ULO6 - Develop an evolving philosophy for what chemistry teaching means ULO7 - Demonstrate an understanding of the relationship between science, technology and society and the cultural context for chemistry that is visible in your teaching ULO8 - Demonstrate critical awareness and understanding of the barriers raised by traditional science and chemistry curricula ULO9 - Value the practice of real-world chemistry ULO10 - Develop as professionals that are knowledgeable, skilful, flexible and compassionate in your practice and are guided by a sense of social and ethical responsibility.

UNIT_TITLE: Drama education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - take a critical position with respect to fundamental scholarly concepts in drama education ULO2 - begin to understand and critically interpret relevant curriculum documents ULO3 - plan purposefully for student learning in secondary drama contexts ULO4 - begin to understand a variety of assessment strategies to evaluate diverse student learning and development in drama ULO5 - begin to enact a range of planning and teaching strategies in order to meet the needs of a diverse range of student learners ULO6 - begin to adopt and enact a reflective approach to continuous professional development as a professional drama educator.

UNIT_TITLE: Drama education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Refine a critical and researched position with respect to fundamental and specialised scholarly concepts in drama education ULO2 - Critically implement the requirements of relevant curriculum documents ULO3 - Independently plan for student learning in secondary drama contexts ULO4 - Design a variety of assessment strategies to evaluate diverse student learning and development in drama ULO5 - Enact a range of planning and teaching strategies in order to meet the needs of a diverse range of student learners ULO6 - Adopt and enact a reflective approach to continuous professional development as a professional drama educator.

UNIT_TITLE: Economics education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - research and critically reflect on the debates about the role and importance of economics education in the secondary school curriculum in order to develop understandings related to your beliefs and your identity in regard to the subject of economics and your teaching of this subject ULO2 - demonstrate knowledge of relevant discipline areas associated with the teaching and learning of economics and related subjects across Years 7 to 12 ULO3 - research, select and evaluate appropriate economics and associated studies teaching and learning resources ULO4 - set clear, challenging and achievable goals for students in their learning of economics and associated studies ULO5 - design innovative teaching and learning procedures to engage and motivate students which respond to the diverse abilities and interests of all learners ULO6 - demonstrate a capacity to draw on a range of teaching approaches, including the use of information and communication technologies, in ways that align with pedagogical intentions ULO7 - critically evaluate your practicum experiences of teaching economics and related studies in schools and other settings.

UNIT_TITLE: Economics education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge of relevant discipline areas associated with the teaching and learning of economics and related subjects across Years 7 to 12 ULO2 - Research, select and evaluate appropriate economics and associated studies teaching and learning resources ULO3 - Set clear, challenging and achievable goals for students in their learning of economics and associated studies ULO4 - Research and design innovative teaching and learning procedures and plans to engage and motivate students which respond to the diverse abilities and interests of all learners ULO5 - Demonstrate a capacity to draw on a range of teaching approaches, including the use of information and communication technologies (ICT), in ways that align with pedagogical intentions ULO6 - Use assessment tasks that are purposeful and relevant to the teaching and learning economics program and the learning needs of students ULO7 - Employ accountable and theoretically grounded processes to monitor and assess student learning and progress ULO8 - Critically evaluate your practicum experiences of teaching economics and related studies in schools and other settings.

UNIT_TITLE: English as an additional language (EAL) education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - draw on existing research in the area of teaching EAL to enact subject appropriate research skills and meet the needs of EAL learners ULO2 - access, adapt and develop materials and teaching activities and critically evaluate resources which meet the diverse needs and identities of EAL learners ULO3 - plan and reflect on engaging lessons using communicative objectives and activities ULO4 - assess the language needs and work of EAL learners ULO5 - generate optimal conditions for language learning ULO6 - appreciate the diverse cultural and language backgrounds of EAL learners and demonstrate sensitivity to differences between learners' cultures and that of the wider Australian community.

UNIT_TITLE: English as an additional language (EAL) education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Draw on appropriate research strategies and resources to plan, implement and evaluate a sequence of lessons that are responsive to diverse student needs ULO2 - Critically evaluate, select, adapt and generate materials and activities relevant to student needs ULO3 - Plan engaging units of work linked to curriculum and best practice ULO4 - Assess the language needs and work of EAL learners informally and formally ULO5 - Critically evaluate EAL resources for classroom use ULO6 - Appreciate the diversity of EAL learners and plan for multilevel classes ULO7 - Demonstrate an awareness of the need to collaborate with colleagues and the community to promote a whole-school approach to the language needs of EAL learners.

UNIT_TITLE: English education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - critically reflect on your beliefs, ethical practices and experiences in regard to the subject of English and in regard to your teaching of this subject ULO2 - use, critically and creatively, a variety of communication strategies in different modes (including a range of ICTs) and in different teaching and learning contexts ULO3 - actively participate in professional conversations and debates about issues pertinent to English education ULO4 - inquire into and develop your professional identity as prospective teachers of English language, literature and literacy ULO5 - investigate the impact of recent language and literacy policy on curriculum, pedagogy, assessment and ethical issues in different subject areas ULO6 - plan for, enact and adjust as appropriate a variety of teaching and learning strategies and practices that meet the needs of a diverse range of student learners, in a variety of settings and curriculum contexts ULO7 - plan for and undertake educational projects or research relevant to your work as professional teachers.

UNIT_TITLE: English education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically reflect on your beliefs, ethical practices and experiences in regard to the subject of English and in regard to your teaching of this subject ULO2 - Use, critically and creatively, a variety of communication strategies in different modes (including a range of ICTs) and in different teaching and learning contexts ULO3 - Actively participate in professional conversations and debates about issues pertinent to English education ULO4 - Inquire into and develop your professional identity as a prospective teacher of English language, literature and literacy ULO5 - Investigate the impact of recent language and literacy policy on curriculum, pedagogy, assessment and ethical issues in different subject areas ULO6 - Plan for, enact and adjust as appropriate a variety of teaching and learning strategies and practices that meet the needs of a diverse range of student learners, in a variety of settings and curriculum contexts ULO7 - Plan for and undertake research into your practicum experiences of teaching English in schools and other settings ULO8 - Design and publish text-related tasks and artefacts for teaching a diverse range of students in schools and collaboratively plan accompanying professional learning activities that could be used with peers and/or professional colleagues in schools.

UNIT_TITLE: General science education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - acquire a sound understanding of key theoretical and pedagogical perspectives and issues in the teaching of science ULO2 - translate conceptual ideas and processes about science into classroom learning activities for students ULO3 - develop an understanding of a constructivist perspective on learning and its implications and a variety of assessment techniques available for use in science education classrooms ULO4 - demonstrate an awareness of the ways in which science education research helps inform teacher practice to enhance student understanding of science concepts across a range of disciplines ULO5 - critically understand the principles of curriculum design as these relate to the content of current general science curricula ULO6 - demonstrate inclusive practices in the teaching of science that account for the diverse experiences and social and cultural backgrounds of your students ULO7 - use and creatively integrate information and communication technologies (ICT) to enhance student engagement and conceptual understanding.

UNIT_TITLE: General science education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Explore ways of facilitating students in their explorations of their own questions and investigations ULO2 - Develop competence in planning and implementing lessons and units of work ULO3 - Become sensitised to the real world of the learners in your classrooms and develop an appreciation for providing learning experiences that are meaningful to students ULO4 - Develop a personal approach to teaching science, through the exploration and experience of a variety of learning and teaching strategies ULO5 - Demonstrate an awareness of the ways in which science education research helps inform teacher practice to enhance student understanding of science concepts across a range of disciplines ULO6 - Critically understand the principles of curriculum design as these relate to the content of current general science curricula ULO7 - Demonstrate inclusive practices in the teaching of science that account for the diverse experiences and social and cultural backgrounds of your students ULO8 - Use and creatively integrate information and communication technologies to enhance student engagement and conceptual understanding.

UNIT_TITLE: Geography education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate an advanced understanding of contemporary approaches and trends in geography education in Australia and internationally ULO2 - develop and implement a differentiated and inclusive geography curriculum including the creative integration of digital technologies ULO3 - design and conduct research into the field of geography education ULO4 - engage learners and communities in geography education to promote a more equitable and sustainable community ULO5 - develop an ongoing capacity to create units of work in response to changing educational policy and theory for secondary school students ULO6 - understand the role of geography both as a separate discipline and as part of an integrated curriculum.

UNIT_TITLE: Geography education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate a critical understanding of contemporary approaches, research and trends in geography education in Australia and internationally ULO2 - Respond to current ideas about the scope and purpose of school geography and apply them in your geography classes, e.g. in relation to ICTs, sustainability, citizenship and personal geographies ULO3 - Plan, resource, teach and assess geography field activities ULO4 - Effectively design geography education lessons that facilitate critical thinking, research, numeracy and literacy skills ULO5 - Demonstrate advanced knowledge of the role of geography both as a separate discipline and as part of an integrated curriculum.

UNIT_TITLE: Health education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the historical, philosophical, curriculum and pedagogical foundations of health education ULO2 - analyse relevant research and competing policy discourses associated with different disciplinary perspectives on health education ULO3 - demonstrate and apply knowledge and understanding to curriculum and lesson planning ULO4 - enact and adjust as appropriate a variety of teaching strategies and practices that meet the needs of a diverse range of student learners, in a variety of settings and curriculum contexts ULO5 - critically evaluate different health education programs and models that seek to influence young people's health ULO6 - engage in critical explorations into public health authorities' practices and policies and apply this knowledge through various forms of research.

UNIT_TITLE: Health education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Develop, design, plan and research lessons, units of work and curriculum appropriate for senior health education ULO2 - Consolidate your understanding of professional knowledge and professional practice in health education ULO3 - Critically analyse the impact of contemporary issues on policy, curriculum and pedagogy in relation to health education in schools ULO4 - Appreciate the importance of professional learning and engagement in a changing society and changing education ULO5 - Reflect on and evaluate your teaching experiences in health education ULO6 - Critically evaluate the impact of recent curriculum and pedagogical innovations in health education.

UNIT_TITLE: History education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - begin to develop your learners' study, career, leisure and life skills through the knowledge, skills, values, attitudes and behaviours associated specifically with the study of history ULO2 - begin to locate, create, use and evaluate history education resources in diverse forms incorporating diverse perspectives and inclusive approaches ULO3 - begin to articulate the research underpinnings of models of historical literacy and thinking, and other pedagogical approaches common to history education, such as inquiry methodology, and enact effectively such models and approaches in diverse learning settings ULO4 - begin to cater to learners' different needs through inclusive strategies and engaging and diverse teaching, learning and assessment activities ULO5 - begin to develop learners' abilities to demonstrate problem-solving capabilities in a variety of ways including creatively, collaboratively and with competence in information and communication technologies (ICTs) ULO6 - begin to facilitate learners' identification of links, similarities and differences between the past and the present and between the experiences of different cultures in different locations ULO7 - begin to develop learners' empathy, values, attitudes and behaviours consistent with informed and positive local and global citizenship for a more equitable and sustainable world.

UNIT_TITLE: History education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Develop your learners' study, career, leisure and life skills through the knowledge, skills, values, attitudes and behaviours associated specifically with the study of history ULO2 - Locate, create, use and evaluate history education resources in diverse forms incorporating diverse perspectives and inclusive approaches ULO3 - Articulate the research underpinnings of pedagogical models common to history education and enact effectively such models in diverse learning settings ULO4 - Cater to learners' different needs through inclusive strategies and engaging and diverse teaching, learning and assessment activities ULO5 - Develop learners' abilities to demonstrate problem-solving capabilities in a variety of ways, including creatively, collaboratively and with competence in information and communication technologies ULO6 - Facilitate learners' identification of links, similarities and differences between the past and the present and between the experiences of different cultures in different locations ULO7 - Develop learners' empathy, values, attitudes and behaviours consistent with informed and positive local and global citizenship for a more equitable and sustainable world.

UNIT_TITLE: Digital technologies in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand the scope of the digital technologies curriculum across secondary school levels ULO2 - plan, resource, teach and assess digital technology lessons that reflect an understanding of education policy, theories, research principles and methods particularly in the junior levels at school ULO3 - develop units of work that include differentiated and inclusive approaches that reflect relevant curriculum and pedagogy for learners in Australian and international contexts with a particular focus on Years 7 to 10 ULO4 - recognise the centrality of literacy and numeracy for effective use of digital technology ULO5 - identify current ideas about how students learn and some implications for your digital technology classes ULO6 - work independently and collaboratively integrating digital technology to enhance learning in classes which reflect digital technology as both a separate discipline and as part of an integrated curriculum ULO7 - identify professional learning needs through critical reflection of practicum experiences ULO8 - critically engage with issues and debates surrounding digital technology in education, including health, equity, ethical and legal implications.

UNIT_TITLE: Digital technologies in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand education policy, theories, research principles and methods and use these to plan, resource, teach and assess digital technology lessons particularly in the senior levels at school ULO2 - Understand and implement relevant curriculum and pedagogy for learners in the post-compulsory Australian (Years 11 and 12) context and apply your knowledge of curriculum and pedagogy in the development of units of work appropriate for digital technology classes ULO3 - Develop ways in which digital technology can support teaching and learning across the school curriculum, including engagement with parents/carers and the wider school community ULO4 - Develop strategies to identify and meet ongoing professional learning needs ULO5 - Engage with professional networks and participate in conversations and debates pertinent to digital technology education ULO6 - Understand the instrumental role digital technology teachers can take in schools including professional learning of colleagues, management of technical services and strategic planning.

UNIT_TITLE: Languages education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the historical, philosophical, curriculum and pedagogical foundations of languages education ULO2 - analyse relevant research and competing policy discourses associated with different applied linguistics perspectives on languages education ULO3 - demonstrate and apply knowledge and understanding to curriculum and lesson planning ULO4 - enact and adjust as appropriate a variety of teaching strategies and practices that meet the needs of a diverse range of student learners, in a variety of settings and curriculum contexts ULO5 - critically evaluate different languages methodologies and programs and models ULO6 - engage in critical explorations and reviews of research and materials for the teaching and learning of languages.

UNIT_TITLE: Languages education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Develop, design, plan and research lessons, units of work and curriculum appropriate for senior languages education programs ULO2 - Consolidate your understanding of professional knowledge and professional practice in second languages education ULO3 - Critically analyse the the impact of contemporary second language teaching and learning issues on policy, assessment practices, curriculum and pedagogy to reflect on practice ULO4 - Appreciate the importance of professional learning and engagement in a changing society and education context ULO5 - Reflect on and evaluate your teaching experiences in languages education ULO6 - Critically evaluate the impact of recent curriculum and pedagogical innovations in languages education. ULO7 - Research critically and creatively a variety of language and intercultural context strategies appropriate to real-world and classroom second language teaching and learning.

ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the historical, philosophical, curriculum and pedagogical foundations of languages education in all learning contexts ULO2 - engage in critical explorations of current and international languages and bilingual education curriculum and policy developments and their F-12 classroom pedagogical implications ULO3 - analyse relevant research and competing policy discourses associated with different schooling perspectives on languages education ULO4 - demonstrate and apply knowledge and understanding to curriculum and lesson planning for a diverse age range of languages students ULO5 - enact and adjust as appropriate a variety of teaching strategies and practices that meet the needs of a diverse range and age of learners, in a variety of settings and curriculum contexts ULO6 - critically evaluate different languages methodologies, programs and models on an F-12 continuum ULO7 - engage in critical explorations and reviews of research and materials for the teaching and learning of languages.

ULO1 - Develop, design, plan and research lessons, units of work and curriculum appropriate for primary and secondary languages education programs ULO2 - Consolidate your understanding of professional knowledge and professional practice in second languages education ULO3 - Critically analyse the impact of contemporary second language teaching and learning issues on policy, curriculum, assessment practices and pedagogy to reflect on practice ULO4 - Appreciate the importance of professional learning and engagement in a changing social and pedagogical context ULO5 - Reflect on and evaluate your teaching experiences in languages education ULO6 - Critically evaluate the impact of recent curriculum and pedagogical F-12 innovations in languages education ULO7 - Research critically and creatively a variety of language and intercultural strategies appropriate to real-world and classroom second language teaching and learning.

UNIT_TITLE: Legal studies education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge of relevant discipline areas associated with the teaching and learning of legal and related studies across Years 7 to 12 ULO2 - research, select and evaluate appropriate teaching and learning resources for legal and related studies ULO3 - set clear, challenging and achievable goals for students in their learning of legal and related studies ULO4 - research and design innovative teaching and learning procedures to engage and motivate the diverse range of learners in every classroom ULO5 - demonstrate a capacity to draw on a range of teaching approaches, including the use of information and communications technologies, in ways that align with pedagogical intentions ULO6 - employ accountable and theoretically grounded processes to monitor student learning and progress ULO7 - critically evaluate your practicum experiences of teaching legal studies and law-related studies in schools and other settings.

UNIT_TITLE: Legal studies education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge of relevant discipline areas associated with the teaching and learning of legal studies and law-related studies across Years 7 to 12 ULO2 - Research, select and evaluate appropriate teaching and learning resources for legal and related studies ULO3 - Set clear, challenging and achievable goals for students in their learning of legal and related studies ULO4 - Research and design innovative teaching and learning procedures to engage and motivate the diverse range of learners in every classroom ULO5 - Demonstrate a capacity to draw on a range of teaching approaches, including the use of information and communications technologies, in ways that align with pedagogical intentions ULO6 - Create assessment tasks that are purposeful and relevant to the teaching and learning program and the learning needs of students ULO7 - Employ accountable and theoretically grounded processes to monitor and assess student learning and progress ULO8 - Critically evaluate your practicum experiences of teaching legal and related studies in schools and other settings.

UNIT_TITLE: Mathematics education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - acquire a sound understanding of key theoretical and pedagogical perspectives and issues in the teaching of mathematics as a subject discipline in secondary schools in Australia and internationally ULO2 - translate conceptual ideas and processes about mathematics into classroom learning activities for students ULO3 - plan and design lessons and units of work that may be suitable for the diverse social and cultural backgrounds and experiences of students ULO4 - develop an understanding of a constructivist perspective on learning and its implications, and a variety of assessment techniques available, for use in mathematics education classrooms ULO5 - become sensitised to the real world of the learners in your classroom and develop an appreciation for providing learning experiences that are meaningful to students ULO6 - develop, through experience and personal inquiry of a variety of learning and teaching strategies, a personal approach to teaching mathematics.

UNIT_TITLE: Mathematics education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Acquire a sound understanding of key theoretical and pedagogical perspectives and issues in the teaching of mathematics as a subject discipline in secondary schools in Australia and internationally ULO2 - Translate conceptual ideas and processes about mathematics into classroom learning activities for students ULO3 - Develop competence in planning and implementing lessons and units of work, including assessment strategies, that may be suitable for the diverse social and cultural backgrounds and experiences of students ULO4 - Explore ways of facilitating students in their explorations of their own questions and investigations ULO5 - Develop an understanding of a constructivist perspective on learning and its implications and a variety of assessment techniques available for use in mathematics education classrooms ULO6 - Become sensitised to the real world of the learners in your classrooms and develop an appreciation for providing learning experiences that are meaningful to students ULO7 - Develop, through experience and personal inquiry of a variety of learning and teaching strategies, a personal approach to teaching mathematics.

UNIT_TITLE: Media education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - critically investigate different rationales and scoping of media studies ULO2 - understand and critically evaluate different approaches to teaching media studies ULO3 - identify, evaluate and use different resources for teaching media studies across different year levels ULO4 - effectively plan and teach media studies lessons for Years 7 to 12 and for students of diverse backgrounds and abilities ULO5 - understand and implement effective assessment tasks for Years 7 to 12 media studies and for students of diverse backgrounds and abilities ULO6 - understand the ethical, safety and legal issues associated with the teaching of media studies in secondary schools and develop procedures to respond to these issues.

UNIT_TITLE: Media education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Further develop your understanding of the scope and purpose of media studies ULO2 - Understand and critically evaluate different approaches to teaching media studies ULO3 - Identify, evaluate and use different resources for teaching media studies across different year levels ULO4 - Develop and critically reflect on sequences of lessons that meet the requirements of various curriculum documents and research the effectiveness of some of these sequences ULO5 - Understand and implement effective assessment programs for Years 7 to 12 media studies and for students of diverse backgrounds and abilities ULO6 - Understand the ethical, safety and legal issues associated with the teaching of media studies in secondary schools and develop procedures to respond to these issues.

UNIT_TITLE: Music education in the secondary years 1A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - develop an understanding of key theoretical and pedagogical perspectives and issues in the teaching of music through critical reflection as part of your professional work ULO2 - begin to translate conceptual ideas and practical processes about music and music engagement into classroom learning activities for students ULO3 - develop an understanding of practical and experiential learning and its implications for use in diverse music education situations ULO4 - begin to explore ways of facilitating students in their explorations of their own questions and investigations ULO5 - develop an understanding of curriculum and assessment in music education ULO6 - begin to develop competence in planning and implementing lessons and units of work ULO7 - begin to develop a wide variety of learning and teaching strategies that support the connections between music theory and practice and formulate a personal approach to teaching music.

UNIT_TITLE: Music education in the secondary years 1B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Acquire a sound understanding of key theoretical and pedagogical perspectives and issues in the teaching of music through professional experience, research and analysis ULO2 - Translate conceptual ideas and practical processes about music and music engagement into classroom learning activities for students ULO3 - Develop an understanding of a performative, experiential perspective on learning and its implications and a variety of assessment techniques available for use in diverse music education situations ULO4 - Develop an understanding of senior secondary curriculum and assessment in music education ULO5 - Develop competence in planning and implementing lessons and units of work ULO6 - Expand your understanding of the diversity of learnings and musics experienced by your students, colleagues and peers to inform your presentation of meaningful and engaging learning experiences ULO7 - Acquire an understanding of holistic learning and teaching including the wide variety of learning and teaching strategies that support the connections between music theory and practice in developing a personal approach to teaching music.

UNIT_TITLE: Music education in the secondary years 2A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - identify and discuss significant issues that surround effective teaching and learning in music, particularly school music departments ULO2 - plan for the establishment and management of school music programs, ensemble programs and performances ULO3 - demonstrate the advanced theoretical and technical knowledge which are required to teach high quality class instrumental music teaching programs that link to the overarching school music program ULO4 - plan for and undertake educational research projects relevant to your work as a professional teacher ULO5 - transmit knowledge, skills and idea about your specialist music area to others in a coherent and clear manner.

UNIT_TITLE: Music education in the secondary years 2B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify and understand significant issues that surround effective teaching and learning in music and communicate these understandings as a clear and coherent exposition of knowledge and ideas to a wider audience ULO2 - Adapt the knowledge and skills learnt throughout the unit to the planning, management and presentation of a school musical production ULO3 - Plan and execute group project work with some independence and be responsible and accountable for your own learning ULO4 - Expand your understanding of experiential music teaching and learning and reflect on supporting practices that can enhance school music education ULO5 - Understand various crucial music education methodologies and apply these newly developed skills and knowledge in the secondary classroom ULO6 - Identify the diversity of strategies, pedagogies and disciplines that will inform your work as a music educator

UNIT_TITLE: Curriculum of outdoor and environmental studies A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate and explain the historical, philosophical, experiential and environmental foundations of outdoor and environmental studies ULO2 - Critically inquire into the purposes and rationales for teaching outdoor and environmental studies in the Australian curriculum ULO3 - Develop content, design and plan lessons, units of work and curriculum that are developmentally appropriate, and that meet the needs of diverse learners in a multicultural world ULO4 - Demonstrate and develop knowledge of a range of resources and teaching/learning activities which support student learning and engagement ULO5 - Critically reflect on your beliefs, attitudes and experiences of outdoor and environmental studies in shaping your educational philosophy, appropriate to curriculum and context.

UNIT_TITLE: Curriculum of outdoor and environmental studies  B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - analyse the historical, philosophical, experiential and environmental foundations of outdoor and environmental studies and the influence of educational policy on this ULO2 - examine the purpose and rationale for teaching outdoor and environmental studies in senior years ULO3 - develop, design and plan lessons, units of work and curriculum content appropriate for outdoor and environmental studies in a range of contexts and settings ULO4 - critically examine the impact of contemporary issues and policy on the development of curriculum and pedagogy in outdoor and environmental studies ULO5 - develop, discuss and incorporate specific assessment practices that are appropriate for outdoor and environmental studies ULO6 - critically assess your professional readiness to effectively understand and successfully implement key curriculum documents in outdoor and environmental studies

UNIT_TITLE: Physical education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO2 - justify the purpose and rationale for HPE ULO3 - articulate and respond to political, social and cultural factors influencing HPE ULO4 - critically engage with a range of curriculum models and pedagogical approaches (related to planning, teaching and assessment) ULO5 - plan HPE lessons, units of work and curricula that are educative, inclusive, and developmentally appropriate ULO6 - source and utilise a range of resources which support student learning and engagement in HPE ULO7 - plan for and undertake research that will strengthen their teaching practice and enhance student learning and engagement.

UNIT_TITLE: Physical education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Develop, design, plan and research lessons, units of work and curriculum appropriate for senior physical education ULO2 - Consolidate your understanding of professional knowledge and professional practice in physical education ULO3 - Examine the impact of contemporary issues on policy, curriculum and pedagogy facing physical education and teachers of physical education ULO4 - Develop an insight into the importance of professional learning and engagement in a changing society ULO5 - Critically reflect and evaluate your teaching experiences in physical education in a school environment.

UNIT_TITLE: Physics education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - articulate and apply your understanding of a constructivist perspective of learning in physics ULO2 - link the everyday world of the learner with physics in ways that are meaningful, relevant and engaging ULO3 - interpret, critique and implement the language, content and assessment methods in senior physics curriculum documents critical for successful physics teaching in secondary schools and colleges ULO4 - develop confidence and a capacity to effectively communicate your advanced physics knowledge using a diverse range of appropriate methods, while planning lessons which encourage purposeful and critical thinking in your students ULO5 - demonstrate an awareness of the ways in which science education research helps inform teacher practice to enhance student understanding of physics concepts ULO6 - critically understand the principles of curriculum design, the content of current senior physics curricula and the pedagogy of physics education ULO7 - apply contexts for the teaching of physics content that accounts for the experiences and social and cultural backgrounds of your students ULO8 - use and creatively integrate information and communication technologies to enhance student engagement and conceptual understanding.

UNIT_TITLE: Physics education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Interpret, critique and implement the language, content and assessment methods in the senior physics curriculum documents useful in contemporary physics teaching in secondary schools and colleges ULO2 - Demonstrate confidence and skill in generating solutions to complex problems in relation to teaching and learning ULO3 - Link the everyday world of the learner with physics in ways that are meaningful, relevant and engaging ULO4 - Engage in critical reflection as a professional teacher and understand contemporary trends in practice and research at the national and international level ULO5 - Use and creatively integrate information and communication technologies to enhance student engagement and conceptual understanding ULO6 - Undertake research and design a comprehensive unit of work suitable for teaching content from a senior physics curriculum ULO7 - Critically reflect on your own professional practice and its importance for effecting continuous improvement ULO8 - Access and employ a variety of authentic assessment and monitoring procedures aimed at evaluating the success of students to meet the intended learning outcomes of the physics curriculum framework.

UNIT_TITLE: Psychology education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - appreciate the nature and scope of psychology as a subject discipline in secondary schools ULO2 - demonstrate familiarity with the curricula policies related to the teaching of psychology, both nationally and internationally ULO3 - follow ethical guidelines when teaching psychology and plan responsibly, especially when carrying out research investigations and teaching potentially sensitive or controversial topics ULO4 - acquire a sound understanding of key theoretical and pedagogical perspectives and issues in the teaching of psychology ULO5 - develop competence in planning and implementing lessons and units of work, including assessment strategies, that embrace the diverse social and cultural backgrounds and personal experiences of students ULO6 - select and utilise appropriate resources, including drawing on current local or global issues and popular media to create effective learning activities that may incorporate information and communication technology (ICT) to suit the school context and the students' learning needs ULO7 - inspire learners of psychology to foster an interest in and positive attitude toward the understanding of human mental processes and behaviours ULO8 - value the links between psychological understandings, the real world and students' everyday lives and consider what it means to be a psychologically literate citizen in today's society ULO9 - work collaboratively with peers to help articulate the pedagogical issues, consider different perspectives and understand that learning to teach is a social endeavour ULO10 - reflect critically on the development of your own teaching and learning to teach psychology.

UNIT_TITLE: Psychology education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Appreciate the nature and scope of psychology as a subject discipline in secondary schools ULO2 - Demonstrate familiarity with the curricula policies related to the teaching of psychology, both nationally and internationally ULO3 - Follow ethical guidelines when teaching psychology and plan responsibly, especially when carrying out research investigations and teaching potentially sensitive or controversial topics ULO4 - Acquire a sound understanding of key theoretical and pedagogical perspectives and issues in the teaching of psychology ULO5 - Develop competence in planning and implementing lessons and units of work, including assessment strategies, that embrace the diverse social and cultural backgrounds and personal experiences of students ULO6 - Select and utilise appropriate resources, including drawing on current local or global issues, popular media to create effective learning activities that may incorporate information and communication technology (ICT) to suit the school context and the students' learning needs ULO7 - Inspire learners of psychology to foster an interest in and positive attitude towards the understanding of human mental processes and behaviours ULO8 - Value the links between psychological understandings, the real world and students' everyday lives and consider what it means to be a psychologically literate citizen in today's society ULO9 - Work collaboratively with peers to help articulate the pedagogical issues, consider different perspectives and understand that learning to teach is a social endeavour ULO10 - Reflect critically on the development of your own teaching and learning to teach psychology.

UNIT_TITLE: Social education in the secondary years A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate a critical understanding of contemporary trends in, and approaches to, social education teaching in Australia ULO2 - identify, evaluate and use different resources for teaching social education ULO3 - effectively plan and teach social education lessons across different year levels and for students of diverse backgrounds and abilities ULO4 - develop units of work that meet the requirements of curriculum for Years 7 to 10 and the post-compulsory Years 11 and 12 ULO5 - understand and implement effective assessment programs for Years 7 to 12 social education and for students of diverse backgrounds and abilities ULO6 - design social education lessons that integrate information and communication technologies ULO7 - design social education lessons that facilitate critical thinking, research, numeracy and literacy skills.

UNIT_TITLE: Social education in the secondary years B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate a critical understanding of contemporary trends in, and approaches to, social education teaching in Australia and internationally ULO2 - Identify, evaluate and use different resources for teaching social education ULO3 - Effectively plan and teach social education lessons across different year levels and for students of diverse backgrounds and abilities ULO4 - Develop units of work that meet the requirements of curriculum documents for Years 7 to 10 and the post-compulsory Years 11 and 12, in either Australian or other global curriculum ULO5 - Understand and implement effective assessment programs for Years 7 to 12 social education and for students of diverse backgrounds and abilities ULO6 - Effectively design social education lessons that integrate information and communication technologies (ICT) ULO7 - Design social education lessons that facilitate critical thinking, research, numeracy and literacy skills.

UNIT_TITLE: Visual art and design education in the secondary years 1A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand the structural issues relevant to lessons and units of work in visual art and design ULO2 - critically determine, and select appropriate content for units of work in visual art and design ULO3 - devise tasks and activities for teaching and learning in visual art and design suitable for diverse learners in a range of educational settings ULO4 - identify important pedagogical issues in visual art and design educational theory ULO5 - apply critical theoretical and conceptual issues to the evaluation of specific examples of visual art and design curriculum practice.

UNIT_TITLE: Visual art and design education in the secondary years 1B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand the structural issues relevant to lessons in visual art and design in relation to classroom practice and prescribed curriculum ULO2 - Critically and creatively design and organise appropriate content for sequences of lessons in visual art and design ULO3 - Devise relevant summative and formative assessment tasks and/or activities for teaching and learning in visual art and design domains ULO4 - Identify and critically discuss relevant pedagogical issues relating to visual art and design educational theory ULO5 - Apply concepts drawn from discipline-based art education (DBAE) and other relevant curriculum models to the evaluation of specific examples of visual art and design curriculum practice.

UNIT_TITLE: Visual art and design education in the secondary years 2A
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand the structural issues relevant to discipline-based knowledge in the visual arts ULO2 - critically determine, select and apply appropriate art historical and art critical tasks ULO3 - devise relevant tasks and activities for museum education in the visual arts and design fields ULO4 - identify important pedagogical strategies in visual art and design (including those that incorporate ICTs) that meet the needs of a diverse range of students ULO5 - apply critical theoretical and conceptual issues to specific examples of visual art and design curriculum practice.

UNIT_TITLE: Visual art and design education in the secondary years 2B
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand relevant structural issues to curriculum evaluation in visual art and design ULO2 - Critically determine and select appropriate assessment mechanisms in visual art and design ULO3 - Consider conceptual problems relevant to the challenge of aesthetic education ULO4 - Identify important pedagogical and aesthetic issues in visual art and design educational theory ULO5 - Apply critical theoretical and conceptual issues to specific examples of visual art and design curriculum practice.

UNIT_TITLE: Educational and developmental psychology placement - assessment
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - apply your advanced professional knowledge and skills for assessment, consultation, counselling and intervention to working with clients ULO2 - demonstrate advanced report-writing skills and apply these appropriately to practice ULO3 - use advanced knowledge of local human service systems and an applied understanding of legal and ethical issues relevant to the area of practice of educational and developmental psychology ULO4 - demonstrate Level 4 competencies in the area of practice of educational and developmental psychology (APAC, 2019) as assessed by the field and university supervisors.

UNIT_TITLE: Educational and developmental psychology placement - intervention
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - apply your advanced professional knowledge and skills for assessment, consultation, counselling and intervention to working with clients ULO2 - demonstrate advanced report-writing skills and apply these appropriately to practice ULO3 - use advanced knowledge of local human service systems and an applied understanding of legal and ethical issues relevant to the area of practice of educational and developmental psychology ULO4 - demonstrate Level 4 competencies in the area of practice of educational and developmental psychology (APAC, 2019) as assessed by the field and university supervisors.

UNIT_TITLE: Educational and developmental psychology placement - general
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - apply your advanced professional knowledge and skills for assessment, consultation, counselling and intervention to working with clients ULO2 - demonstrate advanced report-writing skills and apply these appropriately to practice ULO3 - use advanced knowledge of local human service systems and an applied understanding of legal and ethical issues relevant to the area of practice of educational and developmental psychology ULO4 - demonstrate Level 4 competencies in the area of practice of educational and developmental psychology (APAC, 2019) as assessed by the field and university supervisors.

UNIT_TITLE: Educational and developmental psychology placement - systems
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - apply your advanced professional knowledge and skills for assessment, consultation, counselling and intervention to working with clients ULO2 - demonstrate advanced report-writing skills and apply these appropriately to practice ULO3 - use advanced knowledge of local human service systems and an applied understanding of legal and ethical issues relevant to the area of practice of educational and developmental psychology ULO4 - demonstrate Level 4 competencies in the area of practice of educational and developmental psychology (APAC, 2019) as assessed by the field and university supervisors.

ULO1 - Develop a sound understanding of concepts and contemporary issues in STEM education, contexts and systems, locally and globally ULO2 - Explore the major theoretical and professional debates in STEM education as located within contemporary research ULO3 - Utilise enhanced research and leadership skills to develop sustainable action plans for the engagement of learners in STEM education.

UNIT_TITLE: Content, pedagogy and pedagogical content knowledge in STEM education
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically evaluate research in relation to knowledge underpinning expert teacher pedagogies and practices in STEM and STEM education ULO2 - Design strategies for the effective distribution of PCK in STEM teams ULO3 - Develop strong connections between STEM policy, practice and identity as a leader in this educational field.

ULO1 - Critically evaluate research and practice in the use of digital technologies in STEM curriculum ULO2 - Design strategies for the effective integration of digital technologies to support STEM curriculum ULO3 - Select and use digital technologies in appropriate and creative ways to engage students and support their learning ULO4 - Discuss current and emerging trends in digital technologies and the implications for teaching and learning in STEM ULO5 - Describe relevant issues and strategies to support the safe, responsible and ethical use of digital technologies in learning and teaching.

ULO1 - Articulate how you have extended your current knowledge, skills and abilities needed as a STEM educator ULO2 - Demonstrate an understanding of the contemporary practices of STEM and how such practices help you to respond to changing technological and social change ULO3 - Demonstrate the connections between understandings of STEM practices and educational practices ULO4 - Utilise enhanced research and leadership skills to develop sustainable action plans for the engagement of learners in STEM education.

ULO1 - Identify your skill development in relation to the Australian Professional Standard for Principals Self-Assessment Tool ULO2 - Appraise your current capability against the Australian Professional Standard for Principals and identify areas for future growth ULO3 - Develop cases of your leadership practice which illustrate the values that influence your leadership practice ULO4 - Analyse cases of leadership practice and identify areas for your potential leadership.

ULO1 - Understand the nature of school leadership in the Victorian context, and leadership as a socially and institutionally constructed phenomenon ULO2 - Identify the ways in which leaders learn about leadership and construct their short-term and long-term career trajectories ULO3 - Engage with recent trends in education and leadership theory and practice, as these apply in the Victorian and wider national and global contexts ULO4 - Develop conceptual and theoretical understanding in examining the leadership of teaching and learning, within practice and relevant contexts ULO5 - Apply growing conceptual and theoretical understanding in examining leadership within schools and in initiatives to engage schools with the wider community ULO6 - Develop skills related to the design, generation and interpretation of evidence on which you can base your practice ULO7 - Develop skills related to managing schools and managing resources to support the leading of learning and teaching.

ULO1 - Develop and reflect on your evolving leadership practices and ongoing professional learning in relation to the Australian Professional Standard for Principals ULO2 - Use deep knowledge of teaching and learning to initiate, support and evaluate a strategic area for school improvement ULO3 - Activate improvement through innovation and change ULO4 - Analyse, appraise and synthesise data and evidence from varied sources ULO5 - Identify and communicate key findings to varied stakeholders.

UNIT_TITLE: Counselling skills for individuals, couples and groups
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand, differentiate and critically evaluate the central approaches to counselling and psychotherapy ULO2 - Learn and practise counselling micro-skills in a systematic manner ULO3 - Understand the dynamics and diversity of individual, couple and group counselling and apply your skills accordingly ULO4 - Critically appraise your performance as counsellors ULO5 - Apply information about the therapeutic alliance and other relevant strategies for helping clients in counselling therapy ULO6 - Cultivate sensitivity to other people's cultural and personal ways and preferences ULO7 - Consider and understand your own values and style and your influence on counselling practice ULO8 - Develop treatment plans and produce practice notes.

ULO1 - identify the features of a range of contemporary cognitive behavioural therapies ULO2 - compare the philosophical basis and therapeutic effectiveness of CBT with an alternative evidence-based therapy ULO3 - apply the skills of CBT in counselling ULO4 - develop a case conceptualisation using a cognitive behavioural approach ULO5 - develop a cognitive-behavioural intervention plan.

ULO1 - describe and apply the professional, ethical, social, and legal obligations of counsellors ULO2 - describe and apply the ethical requirements of the societies and professional organisations in the locations in which you plan to practice ULO3 - describe the functions and processes of professional and legal bodies in dealing with ethical matters ULO4 - utilise a formal structure to demonstrate ethical decision making and argue a defensible, well informed ethical position on ethical dilemmas arising in counselling ULO5 - reflect upon one's own professional competencies and limits of proficiency in a range of situations

ULO1 - Demonstrate advanced knowledge and skills of how to approach research in professional counselling practice ULO2 - Examine research-based evidence and evaluate it according to quality indicators ULO3 - Demonstrate an understanding of traditional and innovative advances in counselling assessment and interventions. ULO4 - Extend familiarity on applying digital instruments and tools and implement these in practice ULO5 - Reflect on the legal, ethical and professional principles and practices relevant to various research methodologies and interventions in counselling.

ULO1 - Develop advanced knowledge and skills in professional practice and competency ULO2 - Gain experience in the implementation of ethical principles in field practice ULO3 - Complete a professional log book and case notes ULO4 - Make appropriate specialist and agency referrals ULO5 - Gain an advanced knowledge of local human services systems ULO6 - Understand legal and ethical principles relevant to the field of counselling.

ULO1 - demonstrate competency and advanced knowledge and skills in professional practice ULO2 - apply ethical principles to field practice ULO3 - complete a professional log book and case notes ULO4 - make appropriate specialist and agency referrals ULO5 - demonstrate knowledge of local community and human services ULO6 - understand legal and ethical principles relevant to counselling.

ULO1 - explain the diverse range of professional counselling available ULO2 - demonstrate knowledge of the variety of settings and populations in which counselling takes place ULO3 - demonstrate familiarity with different types of counselling theories and approaches ULO4 - differentiate?and critically appraise the varied forms of counselling ULO5 - apply diverse counselling theories to the different settings in which counselling takes place ULO6 - apply different counselling approaches which are cognisant of the counselling setting.

ULO1 - describe and differentiate major lifespan theories ULO2 - explain the relevance of lifespan theory to counselling ULO3 - recognise how adult attachment style can affect relationships ULO4 - appreciate and cultivate sensitivity to the effects of counselling on the client ULO5 - articulate how an understanding of lifespan and attachment theories can be included in a practical framework for counselling.

UNIT_TITLE: Mental health issues assessment: Grief, trauma and substance abuse
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate an understanding of mental health issues ULO2 - demonstrate an understanding of the main issues in grief and trauma counselling and the application of models of assessment to counselling practice ULO3 - develop and analyse the impact of substance abuse and dependency ULO4 - develop an understanding of assessment techniques for use with grief, trauma and addictions ULO5 - examine the current counselling issues for trauma, grief and addictions.

ULO1 - critically appraise the role of counselling psychology in addressing a range of social, political and cultural issues ULO2 - review evidence and theories regarding multicultural counselling ULO3 - evaluate the relationship between counselling and broader social issues through group discussion ULO4 - develop skills in summarising and presenting ideas in both spoken and written form.

ULO1 - demonstrate an understanding of the major developmental milestones of children and adolescents ULO2 - demonstrate an understanding of typical challenges faced by children and adolescents ULO3 - promote awareness of children and adolescents mental health state ULO4 - explore and apply creative counselling techniques for children such as play/art therapy in enhancing mental health state of children ULO5 - educate parents and community on preventing depression and anxiety for children and adolescents ULO6 - identify and analyse challenges faced by school counsellors ULO7 - respond to and propose relevant counselling intervention for the mental health problems among school children ULO8 - recognize the mental health issues of adolescents and identify the appropriate approaches to counselling adolescents.

ULO1 - articulate the theories of career development and demonstrate familiarity with career counselling techniques ULO2 - apply relevant psychological tools to assess personal characteristics and needs ULO3 - apply career counselling knowledge and skills to plan and implement support at all levels of a person's development.

ULO1 - differentiate and critically evaluate approaches to counselling individuals and couples ULO2 - understand the role of being an individual and couples therapist ULO3 - build sensitivity to other people's cultural and personal ways and preferences in family life ULO4 - explain your own values and style and their influence on counselling practice, and critically appraise your performance as a family counsellor ULO5 - apply counselling skills and produce treatment plans and practice notes.

UNIT_TITLE: Ethics and professional issues in counselling and psychology
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - understand and be prepared to adhere to the professional, ethical, social, legal and moral obligations of counsellors ULO2 - comprehend the ethical requirements of professional societies and organisations in the locations in which you plan to practise ULO3 - explore the functions of professional and legal bodies in dealing with ethical matters ULO4 - develop and demonstrate well informed decision-making processes regarding dilemmas arising in counselling ULO5 - determine professional competencies and limits of proficiency and on actions in a range of situations.

ULO1 - understand the suitability and strengths of group therapy ULO2 - apply diverse theories of group dynamics and interpersonal roles in leading group counselling processes ULO3 - demonstrate the documentation skills for professional group counselling ULO4 - identify the challenges and ethical issues associated with group counselling ULO5 - develop sensitivity to the multicultural nature of group counselling in Malaysia ULO6 - reflect on how to be an effective group counsellor.

ULO1 - identify the features of selected contemporary cognitive behavioural therapies ULO2 - demonstrate the practical application of CBT techniques ULO3 - translate theoretical learning into practical application ULO4 - apply cognitive, reality and behavioural therapies in counselling role plays ULO5 - conceptualise client issues within a CBT framework to facilitate understanding and interventions.

UNIT_TITLE: Advanced personnel and career development counselling
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - apply theories of career development and decision-making to client cases ULO2 - identify and utilise major sources of career information and resources available through community agencies, government facilities, and professional organisations ULO3 - evaluate challenges faced by those in the work place and those seeking employment ULO4 - demonstrate advanced level skills in planning and implementing career development counselling ULO5 - identify issues related to career counselling with diverse or special population and apply career counselling process, techniques and strategies to specific populations.

UNIT_TITLE: Counselling research design, statistics and program evaluation
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - demonstrate the conceptual and practical skills in designing and analysing research ULO2 - identify the appropriate application of a variety of statistical tests ULO3 - apply statistical skills using data analysis software.

ULO1 - choose a research topic within a relevant body of academic scholarship ULO2 - review the field of study thoroughly and identify implications for research ULO3 - plan and schedule the research activities, data analysis and report writing ULO4 - focus a research project on selected research methodologies ULO5 - implement research activities with due regard to ethical procedures and academic conventions ULO6 - demonstrate a capacity to engage in reflective, critical discussion of the relevant research area.

ULO1 - demonstrate an understanding of appropriate assessment procedures necessary to identify symptomatology prevalent in clients ULO2 - conduct clinical intake interviews, as well as mental status exams ULO3 - summarise findings of assessments from professional reports ULO4 - demonstrate an ability to make appropriate recommendations for possible assessments ULO5 - effectively translate assessment findings to interventions.

ULO1 - demonstrate foundational knowledge and skills of professional counselling practice ULO2 - demonstrate foundational intervention planning to address clients' needs ULO3 - apply a variety of assessment instruments and tools in the appropriate context ULO4 - demonstrate skills in case formulation and reporting, and maintaining professional record keeping ULO5 - demonstrate ethical reasoning in appropriate agency referrals and engagement with local community services ULO6 - reflect on the legal, ethical and professional principles and practices relevant to counselling.

ULO1 - Locate a research concern within a relevant body of academic scholarship ULO2 - Review a particular field and identify implications for research ULO3 - Focus a research project on selected research methodologies ULO4 - Use research processes with due regard to ethical procedures and academic conventions ULO5 - Demonstrate a capacity to engage in reflective, critical discussion of the relevant research area.

ULO1 - Develop competency and advanced knowledge and skills in professional practice ULO2 - Gain experience in the implementation of ethical principles in field practice ULO3 - Complete a professional log book and case notes ULO4 - Make appropriate specialist and agency referrals ULO5 - Gain knowledge of local community and human services ULO6 - Understand legal and ethical principles relevant to counselling.

ULO1 - understand how to conduct professional intake interviews ULO2 - synthesise information from multiple sources to develop an integrative case formulation ULO3 - determine the most appropriate evidence based interventions for various presenting issues, diverse population groups and across the lifespan ULO4 - engage in self-reflection to understand the impact of your own values and beliefs when working with clients.

ULO1 - apply the Australian Psychological Society (APS) code of ethics across a variety of contexts and professional roles; ULO2 - identify the ethically complex situations that can develop in the application of psychological principles in practice; ULO3 - draw from a range of empirically supported client and practitioner values and behaviours to ensure ethical behaviour in all aspects of the science and practice of psychology; ULO4 - incorporate decision-making strategies and empirically supported practices to enact and maintain appropriate ethical conduct; ULO5 - integrate ethical principles into psychological work in multidisciplinary workplaces.

ULO1 - demonstrate knowledge of cognitive testing ULO2 - demonstrate knowledge of the impact of psychosocial influences on cognitive performance and cognitive development across the lifespan ULO3 - demonstrate knowledge of the professional ethical, cultural and psychometric issues that arise when assessing for cognitive abilities across the lifespan ULO4 - demonstrate skills in administration, scoring, and interpretation of cognitive instruments ULO5 - demonstrate written and verbal communication skills in reporting the conclusions of cognitive assessments ULO6 - demonstrate reflective skills regarding the use of cognitive tests in professional practice.
