UNIT_TITLE: Indigenous health for nursing and midwifery practice
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Advocacy: Describe advocacy for equitable outcomes and social justice in regard to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health ULO2 - Reflection: Describe how one's own culture and dominant cultural paradigms influence perceptions of and interactions with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples ULO3 - Respect: Recognise Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples' ways of knowing, being and doing in the context of history, culture and diversity ULO4 - Communication: Recognise culturally appropriate, safe and sensitive communication that facilitates trust and builds respectful relationships with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. ULO5 - Safety and Quality: Describe evidence and strengths based best practice approaches in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander health care.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Communication and scholarship in nursing and midwifery
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify the factors that influence health across the lifespan; ULO2 - Apply at a beginning level, critical thinking and reflection for effective person-centred care, particularly in relation to vulnerable populations including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples; ULO3 - Demonstrate therapeutic and clinical communication skills in oral, written and electronic formats; ULO4 - Demonstrate academic writing and database searching skills; ULO5 - Demonstrate beginning level research skills and discuss the importance of evidence-based practice in the provision of effective health care; ULO6 - Identify personal wellbeing strategies.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Global health and cultural competence in nursing and midwifery practice
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify population health indicators particularly as they relate to vulnerable groups including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; ULO2 - Describe the social determinants of health including environmental determinants and the impact of climate change on global health; ULO3 - Discuss the role of the nurse/midwife in mitigation and adaptation; ULO4 - Identify personally held values, beliefs and cultural orientation; ULO5 - Discuss the characteristics of a culturally competent health care workforce and health care system; ULO6 - Describe the role that health promotion and population screening play as preventative measures within health care systems locally and globally.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Fundamental skills and knowledge for nursing and midwifery practice 1
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify and describe the normal structure and function of body systems including basic biochemistry and homeostasis as they affect health across the lifespan; ULO2 - Describe the normal structure and function of cells and tissues, and the associated nursing and midwifery practice considerations; ULO3 - Describe the normal structure and function of the central and peripheral nervous systems, the cardiovascular and respiratory systems as they pertain to a systematic health assessment; ULO4 - Identify and apply the principles of accountable documentation in the recording of systematic health assessment data; ULO5 - Outline the principles of pharmacology, pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics necessary for safe medication administration; ULO6 - Apply knowledge of the nervous, cardiovascular and respiratory systems in the measurement and documentation of vital signs and undertaking an ECG; ULO7 - Outline the supporting evidence for fundamental nursing and midwifery skills. ULO8 - Demonstrate satisfactory performance of fundamental nursing and midwifery skills including assessment of vital signs.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Law, ethics and leadership in nursing and midwifery
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Explain how leadership theories and leader attributes influence teamwork in nursing and midwifery practice. ULO2 - Explore the ethical theories and principles that are relevant in healthcare practice ULO3 - Justify the ethical approaches nurses and midwives need to consider when caring for patients and their families. ULO4 - Identify the legal concepts that apply to the delivery of nursing and midwifery practice. ULO5 - Discuss how nurses and midwives comply with the Australian laws in the healthcare setting. ULO6 - Explain how the NMBA (Nursing & Midwifery Board of Australia) standards and codes for practice underpin the expected behaviour and attitudes of nursing and midwifery practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Fundamental skills and knowledge for nursing and midwifery practice 2
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Describe the normal structure and function of body systems as they affect health across the lifespan, including how the lymphoid system responds to microbes and infection; ULO2 - Identify the normal structure and function of the musculoskeletal system and the nursing/midwifery practice considerations related to associated musculoskeletal conditions. ULO3 - Outline the normal structure and function of the endocrine system and the associated nursing/midwifery practice considerations in the management of related disease processes; ULO4 - Outline the normal structure and function of the digestive system, metabolism and associated nursing/midwifery practice considerations related to minor gastrointestinal conditions; ULO5 - Describe the normal structure and function of the urinary system and fluid balance, electrolyte balance and the nursing/midwifery practice considerations involving urinary tract conditions; ULO6 - Identify the components of the reproductive system and their functions; ULO7 - Plan and implement fundamental nursing care to meet the needs of patients with common and important illnesses including renal, gastrointestinal and endocrine conditions; ULO8 - Demonstrate safe, evidenced based clinical practice integrating theoretical principles and procedural skills; ULO9 - Demonstrate safe, evidenced based principles of medication management related to patient safety.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Introduction to maternity and paediatric nursing
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - ?1. Identify?roles and responsibilities of health professionals in the care of childbearing women, neonates, children &?adolescents. ULO2 - 2. Outline key aspects of the assessment and care of the woman and baby during the antenatal, perinatal and postnatal periods. ULO3 - 3.?Describe a systematic approach to paediatric assessment that reflects changes in growth, development and anatomy and physiology differences. ULO4 - ?4.?Analyse?a variety of communication skills to effectively engage and interact with children, their families and the multidisciplinary health care team ULO5 - 5.?Discuss the impact of hospitalization on the child and family and identify strategies, including family centred care, to support families through the experience. ULO6 - 6.?Identify appropriate management, prevention and health promotion strategies for common childhood illness/injury.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Explain how clinical risk, near misses, errors and risk assessment and incident monitoring promote a culture of patient safety ULO2 - Analyse and apply risk-management principles to identify, assess and report potential risk in the healthcare context ULO3 - Using the principles of quality improvement describe the methods and tools used to measure patient safety ULO4 - Analyse the components of governance within healthcare contexts in relation to patient safety ULO5 - Examine the complexity of the healthcare and safety risks for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; ULO6 - Examine how the nursing practice decision making framework determines the scope of practice of a registered nurse
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply legal and ethical frameworks when planning and delivering mental health nursing care under the Mental Health Act 2014 Victoria. ULO2 - Identify appropriate services available for clients and carers in which to facilitate optimal mental health care, while acknowledging barriers to receiving care, such as stigma, cultural and gender related issues. ULO3 - Employ clinical and critical decision-making skills to identify, analyse and resolve problems in the mental health practice environment. ULO4 - Conduct and document fundamental interview and related assessments of patients who have disturbances in mood, thought, behaviour and perception. ULO5 - Apply knowledge of appropriate therapeutic drugs prescribed for mental health conditions and important associated administration aspects. ULO6 - Demonstrate under supervision, the care of people across the lifespan with mental health disorders.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate professional behaviours, accountability, ethical and legal decision making and a satisfactory knowledge base for safe and coordinated practice in various health settings. ULO2 - Apply knowledge of pathophysiology associated with conditions of the cardiac, respiratory, respiratory, musculoskeletal, renal and endocrine system to the safe delivery of patient-centred nursing care. ULO3 - Discuss and apply pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics and pharmacotherapeutic approaches of relevant medications to a range of diseases and conditions, with consideration of the balance of efficacy and effectiveness. ULO4 - Use a systematic and person centred approach for patient assessment and management, integrating anatomical, physiological, and psychosocial factors. ULO5 - Apply legal and professional principles to the safe preparation and administration of medications, including administration, storage and handling in a range of settings. ULO6 - Demonstrate assessment, preparation, and post-operative care of a surgical patient. ULO7 - Assess, plan, implement and evaluate culturally relevant and age specific nursing interventions for patients requiring medical and/or surgical care. ULO8 - Demonstrate skill development in clinical reasoning by identifying patient problems, implementing interventions, evaluating outcomes and reflecting on learning.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Primary health care and health promotion in nursing and midwifery contexts
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Analyse the key philosophies and frameworks of primary healthcare and health promotion applied in the context of Nursing and Midwifery. ULO2 - Conceptualise the biomedical, behavioural, and socio-environmental approaches to health and health care, and apply these to planning and evaluating sustainable health promotion programs ULO3 - Analyse the concepts of partnership development, community participation, health equity, social justice and capacity building when working with vulnerable populations in primary health care including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples ULO4 - Recognise the role of health literacy and behaviour change in improving health outcomes for various populations including, regional, rural and remote settings ULO5 - Analyse health policy and the ethics of primary health care in relation to the role of the nurse and midwife ULO6 - Explore contemporary challenges and future trends in primary healthcare including refugee health, planetary health and the changing healthcare sector
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply a systematic and person-centred approach for patient assessment and management across the lifespan in a range of healthcare settings ULO2 - Identify patient needs, plan and implement nursing care in a range of healthcare settings ULO3 - Evaluate patient outcomes of implemented nursing care in a range of healthcare settings ULO4 - Discuss the key concepts underpinning family centred care of children and young people ULO5 - Develop and apply age appropriate strategies to facilitate communication with children, young people and their caregivers ULO6 - Apply knowledge of pathophysiology and clinical manifestations associated with specific disorders and disease states across the lifespan ULO7 - Discuss pharmacological options in the treatment of specific disorders and disease states across the lifespan ULO8 - Demonstrate practice at a beginning level in accordance with the Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia (NMBA) Registered Nurse Standard for Practice, Code of Conduct for Nurses, and the International Council of Nurses (ICN) Code of Ethics for Nurses ULO9 - Critically reflect on decisions and judgements made to demonstrate accountability for patient care
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically reflect on key principles, philosophies and approaches that underpin the care of patients requiring acute or persistent pain management, oncology, palliative and end of life care; ULO2 - Critically examine the role of nursing as part of the interprofessional team in pain management, oncology, palliative and end of life care; ULO3 - Outline the pathophysiology related to pain, oncology and palliative conditions. ULO4 - Describe the use of pharmacological and evidence-based complementary therapy options for management in pain, oncology, palliative and end of life care treatment and the common effects experienced by patients receiving related therapies. ULO5 - Discuss the mental health considerations when providing care for individuals experiencing pain and receiving oncology treatment, palliative or end of life care ULO6 - Apply knowledge of legal and ethical considerations to advanced care planning, advocacy and guardianship.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Explore the physiological aspects that influence wound healing; ULO2 - Demonstrate the ability to undertake a comprehensive wound assessment, and to discuss wound characteristics and their relationship to type of dressing product selected; ULO3 - Identify the principles of infection control relating to wound care; ULO4 - Discuss the impact of appropriate wound assessment and provision of comprehensive wound management in the health care setting; ULO5 - Examine the physiological and psychological effects of chronic and acute pain; ULO6 - Analyse and develop a framework for the assessment of pain, disability and physical function, including the use of appropriate tools; ULO7 - Identify current therapeutic and complementary measures to manage pain in the health care setting; and ULO8 - Discuss social and cultural influences on pain and disability and he educational needs of clients in relation to the provision of evidence-based pain management.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Discuss the concept of evidence based practice and its application to clinical practice; ULO2 - Discuss the different forms of knowledge acquisition in nursing and midwifery; ULO3 - Describe the philosophical underpinnings of qualitative and quantitative research; ULO4 - Demonstrate a knowledge of the key aspects within the research process; ULO5 - Discuss the ethical principles underpinning research process; and ULO6 - Assess the quality of evidence derived from nursing and midwifery research literature.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Evaluate contexts where education is provided in clinical practice and the factors that impact on effective teaching and learning ULO2 - Critique relevant educational theories and their relationship to teaching and learning practices ULO3 - Choose and justify approaches for planning, evaluating and assessing teaching and learning. ULO4 - Evaluate the role of education in health promotion ULO5 - Apply the principles of team dynamics and group processes in an interprofessional workshop ULO6 - Conduct a peer teaching session and reflect upon their own perspectives on teaching and learning.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Chronic illness management in primary care
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Discuss perspectives, and the physical, psychological and social aspects of ageing in the context of health and illness in older people in our community ULO2 - Describe the impact of ageing and chronic illness on clients, families and carers and apply this to discharge planning bridging the transition from acute care to primary care and palliative care ULO3 - Analyse the legal and ethical issues that arise from changes to cognition, chronic and life limiting illness such as challenges to autonomy, protection of patients, quality of life and euthanasia ULO4 - Differentiate the roles of nurses working in multidisciplinary teams, who care for people with chronic and/or life limiting illness in different health care environments ULO5 - Utilise holistic health assessment skills to assess the complex health needs of older adults and people with chronic and life limiting illness in relation to physical, psychosocial and spiritual needs ULO6 - Demonstrate and evaluate a range of evidenced based interventions that support the person experiencing complex care needs associated with living with a chronic illness ULO7 - Identify the primary care resources for people with issues related to ageing, chronic and life limiting illness in the community ULO8 - Utilise health promotion, supportive and palliative approaches to care for people with chronic and life limiting illness in a range of health care settings.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Translation of nursing knowledge to complex acute care practice
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply knowledge of pathophysiological, psychological and psychosocial concepts to patients with complex and/or life threatening illness throughout the lifespan. ULO2 - Demonstrate evidence-based knowledge of a range of complex health problems experienced by patients throughout the lifespan in a range of settings. ULO3 - Identify and implement response systems for the deteriorating patient in the clinical setting. ULO4 - Apply knowledge of appropriate therapeutic medications in terms of their mechanism of action, important aspects of pharmacokinetics, adverse effects, interactions and contraindications in the patient with complex and/or life threatening illness. ULO5 - Demonstrate clinical judgement skills to identify, analyse and resolve clinical concerns in the patient with complex and/or life threatening illness. ULO6 - Develop and implement patient-centred care appropriate to the needs and wishes of the patient and their family/carer, inclusive of race, age, gender, sexual orientation, physical or mental state or other diverse needs. ULO7 - Undertake complex nursing activities in a range of health settings, and apply appropriate principles of prioritising and time management appropriate to the clinical setting. ULO8 - Critically reflect on decisions and judgements made to demonstrate accountability for informed patient care. ULO9 - Practice with increasing independence in accordance with the Australian Nursing and Midwifery Council (ANMAC) Professional Standards for the Registered Nurse, Codes of ethics and Code of professional conduct for nurses.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Translation of nursing knowledge in preparation for professional practice
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate a person-centred approach to assessing, planning, implementing and evaluating care and outcomes through the life-span across all healthcare settings. ULO2 - Recognise and respond to the deteriorating patient. ULO3 - Apply evidence-based diagnostic, therapeutic and preventative techniques associated with caring for patients with complex health-care needs. ULO4 - Apply the principles of clinical risk and patient safety in a variety of healthcare settings. ULO5 - Critically reflect on the professional role development of nurses and midwives. ULO6 - Identify and discuss strategies to manage the challenges of contemporary nursing and midwifery practice. ULO7 - Reflect on, identify and develop strategies for personal and professional resilience. ULO8 - Critically reflect on leadership, management, teamwork and inter-professional collaboration in the provision of quality patient care. ULO9 - Apply time management and problem solving skills in the delivery of patient care. ULO10 - Demonstrate effective communication within an inter-professional team to deliver quality patient care.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Translation of nursing knowledge for primary care practice
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate research literacy skills in searching, critiquing and applying evidence; ULO2 - Develop, conduct and evaluate an effective evidence-based peer teaching session; ULO3 - Analyse health literacy as it applies to self-management for people with chronic illness/es ULO4 - Identify the legal and ethical issues that arise from changes to cognition, chronic and life limiting illness and the impact on chronic illness management ULO5 - Incorporate knowledge of the social determinants of health and public policy to support people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and culturally and linguistically diverse population groups, to engage with health services; ULO6 - Evaluate the impact of ageing in the context of health and illness for older people in the community; ULO7 - Differentiate the roles of nurses working in interprofessional teams who care for people with chronic and/or life limiting illness in different healthcare environments; ULO8 - Utilise the health promotion, supportive and palliative approaches to care for people with chronic and life limiting illness in a range of healthcare settings. ULO9 - Apply the Evidence Base Practice Framework to nursing practice focusing on chronic illness management and ageing in primary healthcare practice
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Translation of nursing knowledge for leadership in practice
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply the Safety and Quality Improvement Framework in a variety of scenarios, using a person-centred approach; ULO2 - Apply models of leadership and their contribution to the advancement of the profession, through the conduct of a quality improvement process; ULO3 - Reflect on quality and patient safety outcomes drawn from clinical placement experience ULO4 - Analyse the evidence for an identified area of nursing practice that would benefit from a quality improvement process; ULO5 - Design a quality improvement program for an identified area of nursing practice; ULO6 - Critically analyse literature and evidence supporting clinical and nursing practice ULO7 - Analyse policies, guidelines and evidence based resources within healthcare contexts in relation to leading change.? ULO8 - Appraise peer quality improvement programs using an evidence based evaluation tool
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Clinical honours thesis 1: Applied research methods and skills
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Evaluate and utilise appropriate philosophical foundations of research; ULO2 - Distinguish and critique quantitative and qualitative methodologies; ULO3 - Develop and utilise research skills in the following areas: + advanced online searching; + documentation management; + data collection methods and analysis; and ULO4 - Begin formulating research question and proposed study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Clinical honours thesis 2: Framing a research proposal
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify a research topic that addresses a significant nursing or midwifery issue; ULO2 - Develop a research problem, question or hypothesis; ULO3 - Formulate and present a research plan; ULO4 - Describe the theoretical basis behind the topic and research design; ULO5 - Develop and present a research proposal, including a literature review; ULO6 - Identify issues related to the conduct of the proposed research; ULO7 - Participate in research seminars and workshops; ULO8 - Apply to ethics committees for research approval as necessary; and ULO9 - Demonstrate a collaborative and critical approach to research.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Clinical honours thesis 3: Conducting a research project
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Generate a critical review of the literature and theoretical frameworks relevant to their field of study; ULO2 - Accurately collect, manage and secure data for research activities; ULO3 - Demonstrate an awareness of ethical and privacy issues as they apply to their research proposal; ULO4 - Work collaboratively with a research supervisor to achieve research milestones (e.g. submission of ethics proposal); ULO5 - Finalise the ethics approval process for the project; ULO6 - Respond appropriately to the realities of research project issues including identification of a research site (or sites) and recruitment of participants; ULO7 - Conduct a pilot study (if appropriate) to anticipate and address practical problems that may arise in the course of data collection; ULO8 - Undertake data collection both accurately and ethically; ULO9 - Discuss issues arising during the research process; ULO10 - Demonstrate effective progress towards research plan; ULO11 - Write to an academic standard by incorporating existing research findings and supervisor feedback; and ULO12 - Present research findings in a seminar context.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Clinical honours thesis 4: Analysing and reporting research
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Conduct appropriate data analysis and interpretation; ULO2 - Generate a report on the project, demonstrating critical analysis and discussion of findings in the context of prior research showing due regard to relevant stylistic conventions; ULO3 - Present research findings in a seminar context; ULO4 - Demonstrate an ability to manage data collection and analysis; ULO5 - Work collaboratively with a research supervisor to achieve research milestones; ULO6 - Write to an appropriate academic standard by incorporating existing research findings and supervisor feedback; ULO7 - Respond appropriately to realities of research project issues (e.g. ethical and practical issues surrounding confidentiality, data management etc.); ULO8 - Analyse and present data in a clear, concise and systematic manner; ULO9 - Identify strengths and limitations in their research design; ULO10 - Suggest directions for future research in their specialist area; and ULO11 - Address practicalities of research project management.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply knowledge and concepts of the pathophysiological basis for commonly encountered conditions, and their application to nursing care of clients in medical/surgical settings ULO2 - Perform safe evidence based, person centred clinical practice in an acute care setting based on the integration of theoretical principles and practical skills ULO3 - Describe the nursing application of diagnostic, therapeutic and preventative techniques associated with caring for the deteriorating patient in the clinical setting ULO4 - Formulate, conduct and document comprehensive clinical assessments ULO5 - Critically reflect upon, and evaluate self-performance in terms of the values, attitudes and communication required by nurses when caring for patients and families/carers with diverse health care needs ULO6 - Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of complex health problems experienced by patients throughout the lifespan in the clinical setting ULO7 - Apply knowledge of commonly used pharmacological interventions in the context of drug actions, indications, contraindications, dosage, interactions and reactions in the patient with acute illness ULO8 - Develop and implement patient centred nursing care appropriate to the needs and wishes of the patient and their family/carer, regardless of race, age, gender, culture, sexual orientation, disability or other diverse needs ULO9 - Demonstrate the delivery of complex nursing care and apply appropriate principles of prioritising and time management according to the clinical setting ULO10 - Demonstrate practice at a beginning level in accordance with the Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia (NMBA) Registered nurse standards for practice, Code of conduct for nurses and the International Council of Nurses (ICN) Code of ethics for nurses.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Analyse the concepts of mental health and mental illness with reference to contemporary classification systems ULO2 - Evaluate a range of mental disorders in the context of aetiological factors and epidemiology clinical manifestations, and recommend appropriate mental health nursing care ULO3 - Explain the implications of the Victorian Mental Health Act (2014) for nursing practice in line with recovery oriented mental health practice ULO4 - Explore the role of the recovery oriented mental health practice in gaining and retaining hope, understanding of the clients abilities and disabilities, engagement in an active life, personal autonomy, social identity, meaning and purpose in life, and a positive sense of self ULO5 - Communicate effectively with key stakeholders in the delivery of recovery oriented mental health practice ULO6 - Accurately conduct mental status, risk and other relevant assessments to help inform the provision of safe, high quality patient care ULO7 - Compare and contrast a range of psychotherapeutic interventions and therapeutic modalities utilised in mental health treatment and care ULO8 - Critique the national and international models of health care for chronic conditions and how this approach can lead to improved health outcomes ULO9 - Explore the impact of ageing, chronic, and life-limiting illness on clients, families and carers including the perspectives of challenges to autonomy, protection of patients, and quality of life in order to provide optimal, person centred nursing care ULO10 - Discriminate between health assessment, health promotion, supportive and palliative approaches for people with chronic and life limiting illness to provide appropriate evidence-based nursing interventions ULO11 - Critically examine how the different roles of members in interprofessional teams, work together to provide expert care for people with chronic and/or life limiting illness in different health care environments ULO12 - Demonstrate practice at a beginning level in mental health and primary care settings in accordance with the Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia (NMBA) Registered nurse standards for practice, Code of conduct for nurses and the International Council of Nurses (ICN) Code of ethics for nurses.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply adult learning principles to critically reflect on their specific learning needs in preparation for registration as a nurse ULO2 - Effectively apply a systematic approach to identify, assess and care for the deteriorating patient ULO3 - Critically evaluate the clinical management principles of the acutely deteriorating patient ULO4 - Evaluate the contribution of teamwork and interdisciplinary collaboration in the provision of quality nursing care ULO5 - Undertake complex nursing activities in a range of clinical settings and effectively apply prioritising, problem solving and time management skills ULO6 - Critically reflect on their own actions, professional development and on the nature of nursing practice in relation to the nursing management of clients' health needs ULO7 - Reflect on, and evaluate, self-performance related to knowledge, skills and delivery of nursing care ULO8 - Critically reflect on decisions and judgements made to demonstrate accountability for informed patient care ULO9 - Practice with increasing independence at a beginning registered nurse level in accordance with the Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia (NMBA) Registered nurse standards for practice, Code of conduct for nurses and the International Council of Nurses (ICN) code of ethics for nurses.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Integrate psychotherapeutic skills as a key part of mental health nursing practice. ULO2 - Critically analyse the various approaches to psychotherapy utilised by mental health nurses to meet client care needs in a variety of settings. ULO3 - Synthesize a variety of psychotherapeutic techniques as a means to explore which approach to psychotherapy would best apply to the client and or situation. ULO4 - Critically appraise factors that positively affect psychotherapy outcomes. ULO5 - Formulate and implement treatment plans based on evidence-based practice, incorporating psychotherapeutic interventions to address client goals and presenting problems. ULO6 - Evaluate the effectiveness of your psychotherapeutic interventions in the clinical setting. ULO7 - Recognise the importance of self-awareness in daily practice. ULO8 - Argue the relevance of ongoing self-reflection for the advancement of your psychotherapy practice throughout your career.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Explore the evolution of contemporary nursing practice from an international and Australian perspective ULO2 - Describe the Australian healthcare system and how nurses practice in these settings ULO3 - Discuss common and statute laws relevant to professional practice ULO4 - Evaluate the legal concepts and mechanisms that underpin the practice of nursing ULO5 - Utilise legal and professional standards in the various practice related scenarios ULO6 - Analyse the legal implications of actions taken in nursing practice ULO7 - Discuss and apply ethical theories relevant to nursing practice ULO8 - Identify and appraise ethical dilemmas that arise in health care and resolution strategies ULO9 - Explore ethical and legal aspects of end of life decision making ULO10 - Identify and assess the effectiveness of strategies to address bullying and to de-escalate violence and aggression in the workplace.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically analyse the meaning of health and the broad principles of public health such as equity, community engagement and partnerships to undertake a health needs assessment. ULO2 - Analyse the key philosophies and frameworks of primary healthcare and health promotion. ULO3 - Identify population health indicators particularly as they relate to vulnerable groups including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. ULO4 - Recognise the role of health literacy and behaviour change in improving health outcomes for diverse population groups. ULO5 - Describe the social determinants of health including environmental determinants and the impact of climate change on primary and global health. ULO6 - Critically evaluate the impact of cultural diversity on health and illness behaviour and develop strategies to incorporate the issues of cultural safety and cultural competence within nursing practice. ULO7 - Recognise the elements of therapeutic communication with particular reference to working with people from diverse cultural backgrounds and age groups. ULO8 - Incorporate the issues of cultural safety and cultural competence by reflecting on personally held values, beliefs and cultural orientation related to cultural sensitivity. ULO9 - Determine barriers associated with access to, and equity in health care particularly as they relate to Indigenous Australians and people in different vulnerable groups. ULO10 - Identify the characteristics of a culturally competent health care workforce and health care system.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Assess a clients learning needs and use appropriate teaching methods and teaching aids ULO2 - Describe and critique theories of learning ULO3 - Develop and implement plans for health teaching and promotion ULO4 - Differentiate the types of literature and literature reviews ULO5 - Discuss the concept of knowledge generation in professional nursing ULO6 - Describe philosophical underpinnings, methodologies and principles of research relevant to nursing practice ULO7 - Explain the generation of knowledge in nursing through the critique of research ULO8 - Discuss the ethical principles underpinning the research process ULO9 - Recommend strategies for the dissemination of knowledge to facilitate improved health outcomes ULO10 - Identify strategies for the translation of research evidence to nursing practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply anatomical and physiological principles to the outcomes of patient assessment and care planning process ULO2 - Integrate theory, clinical problem solving, communication and decision making skills to systematically assess a patient in the acute clinical setting ULO3 - Accurately perform comprehensive health and physical assessment skills in simulated and clinical practice environments ULO4 - Plan and evaluate patient assessment data across the lifespan, using clinical problem solving and decision-making processes to justify care interventions in acute settings ULO5 - Plan, implement and evaluate nursing care using a person-centred approach ULO6 - Apply the principles of pharmacology to therapeutic drug administration and monitoring to ensure medication safety ULO7 - Analyse and apply the legal and professional nursing requirements associated with quality use of medications ULO8 - Perform fundamental nursing care skills to maintain and ensure patient safety using an evidence-based and professional approach in the clinical environment ULO9 - Identify the core principles of palliative care and the resources available for people with life limiting illness ULO10 - Demonstrate practice at a beginning level in accordance with the Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia (NMBA) Registered nurse standards for practice, Code of conduct for nurses and the International Council of Nurses (ICN) Code of ethics for nurses.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate an in-depth understanding of how specific software application (e.g. word processing, spreadsheet, database, presentation and statistics) may be applied to nursing practice, education, administration and research; ULO2 - Describe the role of database, communication and network technology in the development, implementation and utilisation of information systems; ULO3 - Evaluate current trends in communication and network technology and their impact on Health Information Systems; ULO4 - Analyse and evaluate a number of information sources such as CD-ROM databases and websites related to nursing knowledge in general and specifically to Nursing Informatics; ULO5 - Demonstrate an ability to competently utilise communication applications such as email, newsgroups, intranet and Internet audio/video technology and evaluate their benefits to health care; ULO6 - Outline the role of various computer architectures in the provision of Information Systems; ULO7 - Analyse a number of networking structures and topographies; ULO8 - Understand issues related to informatics ethics, privacy and confidentiality; ULO9 - Evaluate the role of network security in maintaining information system integrity; ULO10 - Analyse a number of information technology implementation strategies and outline their impact on Nursing Informatics; ULO11 - Discuss the role of data standards and case mix in health informatics; ULO12 - Demonstrate an understanding of current trends in health care and how they influence the development, implementation and utilisation of information systems; ULO13 - Analyse a number of Clinical Information Systems and determine their role in improving nursing care.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Discuss recent trends within your health profession with particular reference to simulation, interprofessional and co-designing education with health care consumers. ULO2 - Critically evaluate and reflect on current and future educational roles and contexts that encompass education in health care practice. ULO3 - Investigate and critically analyse a range of educational learning theories and their potential application to health professions education. ULO4 - Apply evidence-based educational practices to plan, design and implement an education session for health care practitioners. ULO5 - Demonstrate competence as an educator, including critical self-reflection and evaluation of own teaching practice ULO6 - Contrast and critique contemporary teaching and learning methods for a range of clinical and academic education contexts. ULO7 - Describe and critique common workplace, clinical supervision and teaching models. ULO8 - Build your own teaching philosophy to demonstrate applied understandings and approaches to your own teaching practice. ULO9 - Develop and apply reflective skills through linking past and present learnings to future education in health care practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Describe fundamental principles of pharmacology; ULO2 - Describe the processes involved in pharmacokinetics along with factors that influence these processes; ULO3 - Explain indications, actions, adverse reactions and contraindications for commonly prescribed medication; ULO4 - Demonstrate clinical decision making ability relating to pharmacology within own specific practice area; ULO5 - Utilise the quality use of medicines principles in medication management decision making; ULO6 - Provide appropriate education for clients based upon individual medication regimes; ULO7 - Analyse medication regimes for discipline-specific clinical conditions in their area of practice; ULO8 - Critically analyse the implications of medication use across the lifespan; ULO9 - Analyse and discuss the legal, ethical and professional responsibilities associated with prescription and administration of medications in their jurisdiction; ULO10 - Critically analyse social and political factors that influence use of medications in their jurisdiction; ULO11 - Demonstrate knowledge and capacity in all relevant aspects of the prescribing of medications (within individual scope of practice requirements [Nurses who prescribe only])
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically examine contemporary factors that influence education program development ULO2 - Examine models of curriculum designs relevant to education and healthcare practice ULO3 - Undertake an education needs assessment (ENA) in your workplace ULO4 - Analyse the results of ENA and identify goals and objectives related to learning needs ULO5 - Apply evidence based educational practices to plan, design and develop an education program ULO6 - Design an appropriate assessment and evaluation strategy for an education program ULO7 - Appraise learning theory in education research and inquiry ULO8 - Explore innovation and simulation methodologies in program development ULO9 - Enhance understanding of the role of giving and receiving effective feedback for learning
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Develop a plan including the essential elements of leadership and management for nursing in disaster prevention, preparedness, response and recovery; ULO2 - Explain the concept of a safe hospital in disaster and the safe hospital index; ULO3 - Analyze strategies for investing in a disaster informed nursing workforce within local and international settings; ULO4 - Evaluate the resources available to enhance the resilience of the nursing workforce in disaster; ULO5 - Identify when community resilience is compromised and what is needed to build that resilience; ULO6 - Analyze the competing issues of core competencies, expanded scope of practice and ethical practice in the context of response for nurses; ULO7 - Conceptualise the value of using a disaster research framework for a research study of a mass casualty incident; ULO8 - Identify the special needs of vulnerable populations in disaster situations.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Analyse critically complex problems associated with hospital and nurse leadership responses to local disasters and major incidents. ULO2 - Prepare a hypothetical nursing leadership in the moment decision and response to serve a major hospital in response to a local disaster or major incident ULO3 - Critically review nursing leadership skills in terms of decision making, coordination, liaison in planning for a local disaster or a major incident. ULO4 - Research and review government policies and advice that provide guidance to hospitals and nursing leaders regarding generating responses to local disasters or major incidents. ULO5 - Communicate a hypothetical nursing leadership response to a local disaster or major incident to specialist and non-specialist audiences ULO6 - Create a business continuity plan for nursing services for application in the event of a local disaster or a major incident.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically analyse a variety of approaches to psychological interventions; ULO2 - Develop a greater awareness of self and the ways in which personal attributes affect interaction with clients and others; ULO3 - Demonstrate acquisition of communication skills required for effective psychotherapeutic interaction; ULO4 - Plan interventions and establish goals to meet the needs of the client; ULO5 - Practice the relevant skills for effective counselling in a variety of clinical settings; ULO6 - Discuss a range of contemporary issues in psychological interventions; ULO7 - Critically appraise the evidence available regarding the efficacy of the approaches to psychological interventions; ULO8 - Develop an understanding of cultural psychosocial aspects which influence the development of a therapeutic relationship and counselling role.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Mental health nursing concepts and practice
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically discuss and apply assessment frameworks used in mental health nursing with consideration to social, psychological and cultural factors of consumers ULO2 - Discuss mental health nursing approaches (non-pharmacological) and best practice to support peoples mental health and their recovery ULO3 - Integrate knowledge of psychotropic medications used in mental health practice to support peoples mental health and their recovery ULO4 - Critically examine the role of the mental health nurse in non-pharmacological and pharmacological approaches to treatment ULO5 - Plan, implement and evaluate person-centred nursing interventions that support the recovery of people with a lived experience of mental disorders ULO6 - Critically analyse the diagnostic classification systems used in mental health and the impact on consumers ULO7 - Apply relevant legislation into mental health nursing practice, such as the Mental Health Act and policy related to the delivery of mental health care ULO8 - Integrate and apply knowledge of legal, ethical and human rights issues as they pertain to decision making in mental health practice ULO9 - Apply person-centred, recovery focused and trauma informed care in all aspects of mental health nursing practice ULO10 - Determine the role of families and caregivers in all aspects of mental health practice to support a person in their recovery

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Describe the aetiology, clinical manifestations and pathophysiology of a range of diseases/conditions observed in children; ULO2 - Plan and implement appropriate, evidence based, therapeutic nursing interventions related to the management of paediatric patients; ULO3 - Plan and implement appropriate, evidence based, therapeutic nursing interventions related to the management of children with complex health needs; ULO4 - Critically analyse the clinical issues supporting and complicating advanced practice in paediatric nursing; ULO5 - Analyse the collaborative interdisciplinary team approach to management of paediatric patients.

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply extended skills in diagnostic reasoning to speciality nurse practitioner practice ULO2 - Synthesise and interpret findings from clinical assessment and diagnostic tests to plan and implement appropriate, evidence-based preventive and/or therapeutic interventions ULO3 - Design and develop a learning package targeting advanced clinical decision making relevant to speciality nurse practitioner practice ULO4 - Implement sound clinical decisions that are cognisant of the impact of social and cultural factors on the health of individuals and communities ULO5 - Evaluate the specific health care needs of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and incorporate their cultural beliefs and practices into interactions and care planning ULO6 - Implement culturally safe nurse practitioner practice ULO7 - Critically analyse the scope of nurse practitioner practice in a specific practice area and how it contributes to the organisation and the community ULO8 - Explain the professional, legal and ethical responsibilities associated with the nurse practitioner role to stakeholders ULO9 - Critically analyse clinical issues that support or complicate nurse practitioner practice
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Describe the characteristics of an efficient and cost effective comprehensive mental health service; ULO2 - Critically analyse contemporary approaches to mental health service delivery; ULO3 - Discuss the importance of consumer and carer perspectives and participation in mental health service delivery; ULO4 - Describe the mental health nurse's scope of practice in a range of health care contexts; ULO5 - Demonstrate understanding of the needs of special populations including people from non-English speaking backgrounds, refugees, homeless people; ULO6 - Discuss the influence of culture, gender and coexisting conditions on the care of people with mental health problems and disorders; ULO7 - Act as an effective leader, health educator, resource person and catalyst for change to individuals, families, health professionals and the community.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Theories and philosophies of mental health nursing
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Review and appraise the significance of selected nursing theories and philosophies to contemporary mental health nursing practice. ULO2 - Integrate core values of mental health nursing into care provision with consumers; in scenario work and in mental health nursing workplaces. ULO3 - Use recovery-oriented principles of care to achieve: consumer self-determination; inclusiveness, nurturance, growth and development; and shared decision-making. ULO4 - Assess consumers' relationships with their environments; and problem solve issues of safety, the promotion of wellness, and advocacy for unmet and special needs. ULO5 - Distinguish different mental health nursing interventions that can be applied to gain attainment of therapeutic relationships and environments in a variety of consumer situations. ULO6 - Create comprehensive and evidence-based mental health nursing care plans across a range of consumer needs.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Challenges and controversies in mental health nursing practice
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Appraise and apply advanced mental health nursing engagement frameworks for the care of complex and hard to engage mental health clients. ULO2 - Critically examine integrative mental health care policies and frameworks that can be used to plan and manage the care of mental health clients with complex and chronic illnesses. ULO3 - Consider the relevance and utility of models and frameworks that can be applied in mental nursing contexts to innovate services and care. ULO4 - Appraise observational and interventional methods that can be applied to evolve the efficacy of workplace culture in mental health care settings. ULO5 - Consider professional strategies that involve the use of nursing voice and advocacy to influence mental health care and mental health nursing. ULO6 - Create comprehensive and evidence-based mental health nursing care plans and interventions across a range of complex care situations and workplace contexts.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically analyse a practice issue; ULO2 - Evaluate the unique cultural aspects of the context of practice; ULO3 - Recommend key stakeholders in managing a practice issue; ULO4 - Plan a principles and evidence based nursing practice project that addresses a practice issue; ULO5 - Apply initiative, interpersonal and independent problem-solving skills to practice issues; ULO6 - Collect, analyse and synthesise information about the identified issues to inform practice change; ULO7 - Recommend evidence based solutions to practice issues; ULO8 - Write a scholarly report on a nursing practice project; ULO9 - Present the project methods, synthesised findings and the arising recommendations needed to influence practice change.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify personal clinical leadership goals; ULO2 - Assess clinical leadership readiness and related skill sets of nurses in practice; ULO3 - Critically analyse leadership theories relevant to nursing practice and their application in clinical nursing services; ULO4 - Construct and critique strategies for clinical development through leadership; ULO5 - Evaluate outcomes of successful leadership; ULO6 - Evaluate clinical development outcomes produced through leadership intervention.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Leading improvement and innovation in the quality and safety of nursing and health care
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critique the historical and contemporary context for improving the quality and safety of nursing and health care in Australia and internationally. ULO2 - Describe the role of clinical governance in the prevention and minimisation of clinical risks and adverse outcomes in nursing practice. ULO3 - Identify evidence relating to the presence, risks and approaches to addressing specific care quality and safety issues in nursing practice. ULO4 - Critique approaches and techniques for improving specific care quality and safety issues in contemporary nursing practice. ULO5 - Apply contemporary approaches and techniques in developing plans and interventions for improving the quality and safety of nursing and health care.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Management and leadership of professional nursing practice
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Examine leadership and management responsibilities and outcomes associated with the organisation of professional nursing practice ULO2 - Critique contemporary methods of organising professional nursing work in a range of practice contexts ULO3 -  Apply leadership and management principles to a nursing / midwifery practice setting to ensure delivery of safe, quality care  ULO4 - Describe professional and workplace governance structures that have been proven to be successful in particular nursing / midwifery workplace contexts ULO5 - Identify drivers for change (e.g. industry and technology reforms; political, business and social agendas) and proactively lead nursing responses to changing and dynamic environments ULO6 - Critique commonly used strategies for strategic planning and operational implementation in particular nursing / midwifery workplace contexts ULO7 - Recommend techniques related to enhancing interdisciplinary engagement that can be used in nursing / midwifery leadership and management situations ULO8 - Utilise leadership and management principles to influence health services and professional organisations to enhance the voice of nurses and midwives in improving the quality of service delivery and health policy development ULO9 - Evaluate the implementation of a specific management and leadership strategy in the conduct of nursing work
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Advanced clinical assessment and diagnostic reasoning
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate a structured approach to an advanced focused health assessment for each body system. ULO2 - Perform advanced, comprehensive and holistic health assessment in an area of specialist practice. ULO3 - Document relevant findings from patient assessment in a succinct and systematic manner. ULO4 - Analyze the contribution of physical, emotional, psychological, social, and cultural factors to health assessment. ULO5 - Outline common investigative options relevant to area of specialist practice. ULO6 - Analyze clinical assessment findings to make decisions about investigative options. ULO7 - Interpret and analyses results from diagnostic tests in the context of the patient physical assessment. ULO8 - Synthesize findings from assessment and diagnostic tests to formulate clinical impressions and identify differential diagnoses. ULO9 - Analyze the role of technology in supporting diagnostic reasoning in the specific clinical context.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate achievement of the advanced knowledge, skills and attitudes required of a Nurse Practitioner ULO2 - Demonstrate high level interpersonal, problem solving and clinical decision making in the professional practice ULO3 - Provide holistic, person-centred advanced nursing care in specific health care settings ULO4 - Utilise research to enhance health outcomes and evaluate nursing interventions ULO5 - Plan, deliver and evaluate health programs and services ULO6 - Analyse ethical, legal and political aspects of the Nurse Practitioner role ULO7 - Develop advanced skills in medication management, health assessment and diagnosis ULO8 - Demonstrate achievement of the NMBA: Nurse Practitioner Standards for Practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Analyse the pathophysiological processes underpinning complex disease states including neurological, cardiac, respiratory, gastrointestinal, renal and endocrine body systems in specialist nursing practice. ULO2 - Apply a structured approach to the assessment of patients with complex disease including neurological, cardiac, respiratory, gastrointestinal, renal and endocrine body systems in specialist nursing practice. ULO3 - Critically evaluate pharmacological interventions to manage patients with complex disease states including neurological, cardiac, respiratory, gastrointestinal, renal and endocrine body systems in specialist nursing practice. ULO4 - Plan and evaluate evidence-based practice to manage patients with complex disease states including neurological, cardiac, respiratory, gastrointestinal, renal and endocrine body systems in specialist nursing practice. ULO5 - Analyse the pathophysiological processes underpinning shock states in specialist nursing practice. ULO6 - Critically evaluate evidence-based practice to assess and manage patients in a shock state in specialist nursing practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Pathophysiology for advanced paediatric clinical nursing
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Describe anatomical and physiological changes of major body systems associated with growth and development from neonate to adolescence and explain these differences compared to adults. ULO2 - Explain the aetiology and pathophysiological processes associated with disease progression in a range of conditions observed in children. ULO3 - Correctly interpret physiological data in the context of pathophysiology associated with a range of diseases and conditions observed in children. ULO4 - Using example pathophysiological data and cases, consider theoretical principles related to the nursing management of sick children. ULO5 - Apply pathophysiological understandings in the assessment sick children and their nursing requirements.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Implement a ?comprehensive patient assessment during each phase of the perioperative journey: pre-operative, intra-operative and post-operative. ULO2 - Critically review evidenced based principles used to deliver and prioritise patient care ULO3 - Effectively manage the deteriorating perioperative patient. ULO4 - Evaluate and apply the principles of asepsis and infection control in the perioperative setting. ULO5 - Apply legal requirements, ethical considerations and regulatory standards to the delivery of person-centred care in the perioperative setting. ULO6 - Determine and discriminate between surgical, anaesthetic and post-operative risk factors that impact patients surgical journeys.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 -  Critically assess and influence multi-disciplinary team communication and clinical decision-making.  ULO2 - Identify, adapt and apply necessary clinical and management strategies related to specific speciality areas of perioperative nursing. . ULO3 - Critically analyse variations in clinical manifestations and the relevant nursing care related to a variety of speciality areas and surgical procedures. ULO4 - Review contextual factors that influence perioperative nursing care and patient journeys. ULO5 - Analyse and explain the complex care requirements for patients with special healthcare needs presenting to the perioperative environment. ULO6 - Explore the impacts of ?workplace factors on the patients perioperative journey, from both patient and organisational perspectives.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Explain the global and socio-political aspects of refugee and asylum seeker journeys and settlement ULO2 - Critically examine primary health care and service co-ordination practices within the refugee context ULO3 - Understand the impact of torture and trauma on refugee populations and the Australian health care system ULO4 - Analyse approaches to cultural responsiveness, health literacy and consumer participation within the refugee context ULO5 - Identify nursing skills required for refugee health assessment and care within the individual and family context ULO6 - Recognise and develop professional boundaries and skills to assist the nurses and midwives when working with refugees.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Expand on concepts from previous studies of health and nursing to be able to undertake leadership roles in population health and health promotion; ULO2 - Critically analyse national and international frameworks for primary health care and health promotion initiatives with special references to the work of the World Health Organisation (WHO); ULO3 - Appraise major community health needs and issues of clinical relevance, with particular focus on vulnerable communities; ULO4 - Analyse various methods of population-based approaches to data collection; ULO5 - Utilise national and international collaborative health practice models in designing population-based approaches to health care; ULO6 - Apply health promotion principles such as equity, community engagement and partnerships to undertake a health needs assessment.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Working cross-culturally in contemporary health care
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Define and differentiate between the commonly used and interchangeable terms used in health care when working cross-culturally. ULO2 - Critically analyse challenges to access health care including health disparities and inequities for people from CALD backgrounds and major health issues affecting them today. ULO3 - Explore the individual health professionals skill, knowledge and attitudes that facilitate culturally competent health service delivery. ULO4 - Critically analyse the benefits and challenges of working in disciplinary and interdisciplinary contexts with health care providers who are from diverse cultural and linguistic contexts; and identify. strategies for achieving effecting teamwork. ULO5 - Reflect on health care professionals own culture and its potential impact on caring for others and working with other health care professionals who have different cultural backgrounds. ULO6 - Critically analyse organisational and systems governance structures and existing policies that improve the culturally competent health care.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Analyse traditional models and behavioural change approaches to health education; ULO2 - Analyse behavioural change theory from the perspective of long term change and complex psycho-social situations; ULO3 - Evaluate contemporary health education theory in changing health behaviours; ULO4 - Examine the social context of where individual and communities live and how this relates to promoting health and health education; ULO5 - Construct and critique health education strategies to include consideration for varying levels of health literacy; ULO6 - Design a health education plan with a focus on long term change in a complex environment.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: End of life care in nursing contexts
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Appraise common issues associated with end of life care in a variety of health care contexts. ULO2 - Skilfully communicate end of life issues with patients, families, nurses and other health professionals ULO3 - Work with the concerns of families or proxy decision-makers when patients are deteriorating and/or when patients are not responding well to interventional care ULO4 - Recognise when patients are approaching the end of life and engage appropriate models of care ULO5 - Establish and operationalise advance care planning methods and tools ULO6 - Design strategies for building capacity in nursing and inter-professional teams to manage and support end of life care
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Perform clinically at a minimum required standard, in accordance with the Australian College of Critical Care Nurses' Practice Standards for Specialist Critical Care Nurses (ACCCN, 2015) ULO2 - Analyse and explain the pathophysiological processes underpinning critical illnesses commonly experienced by patients admitted to ICU with actual or potential vital organ dysfunction ULO3 - Implement a structured holistic assessment of an intensive care patient, by using an appropriate assessment framework that includes the initiation of relevant diagnostic tests and critically evaluate the findings to inform your assessment and ongoing patient ULO4 - Plan, prioritise and implement age appropriate, culturally relevant and evidence-based therapeutic interventions for critically ill patients experiencing complex disease states by applying clinical reasoning related to the pathophysiology of their illness. ULO5 - Critically evaluate the socio-cultural, legal and ethical issues related to the nursing management of the critically ill patient. ULO6 - Communicate professionally and empathetically with patients, their families and members of the multi-disciplinary team. ULO7 - Identify the needs of the patient's family and significant others in the ICU and plan appropriate nursing interventions to address these needs. ULO8 - Problem solve ?and manage ??????common technological interventions used to support the critically ill patient with vital organ dysfunction to provide safe, quality care (e.g. mechanical ventilation) ULO9 - Conduct Advanced Life Support underpinned by the Australian Resuscitation Council (ARC)/ANZCOR guidelines including the safe transport of critically ill patients to other clinical areas.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Perform at a minimum required standard, in accordance with the Australian College of Critical Care Nurses' Practice Standards for Specialist Critical Care Nurses (ACCCN, 2015) ULO2 - Critically analyse the pathophysiological processes underpinning complex disease or injury states ULO3 - Implement a structured and holistic assessment of a complex intensive care patient with multiple organ dysfunction, by applying an appropriate assessment framework and critical evaluation of the findings to inform your assessment ULO4 - Identify, prioritise and implement age-appropriate, culturally relevant therapeutic interventions for patients experiencing complex disease or injury states ULO5 - Adapt and apply the core principles of intensive care nursing to specialist patient populations (e.g. patient with multiple trauma, burns, paediatrics, pregnancy). ULO6 - Critically evaluate the continued development of intensive care therapies, analysing contemporary nursing issues, while identifying areas for future research, development, quality improvement and policy. ULO7 - Explore socio-cultural, legal and ethical issues associated with the provision of intensive care to patients and their families  such as the provision of end of life care and organ donation in the ICU. ULO8 - Critically assesteamwork, leadership and the professional attributes that are essential in the intensive care setting. ULO9 - Demonstrate teamwork, leadership and the professional attributes that are essential in the intensive care setting.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Discuss the pathophysiological processes underpinning complex disease states. ULO2 - Plan and implement appropriate, age specific, culturally relevant, therapeutic interventions for patients experiencing complex disease states. ULO3 - Plan and execute the assessment and management of an adult patient with a complex illness or injury. ULO4 - Articulate and demonstrate the principles used to manage a medical emergency in all age groups within an emergency department. ULO5 - Communicate professionally and with empathy with patients, their families and members of the multi-disciplinary team. ULO6 - Identify the needs of the patient's family and significant others in the emergency department and plan appropriate nursing interventions to address these needs. ULO7 - Explore and evaluate the clinical application of nursing research and theoretical literature to selected problems related to the above groups in emergency care. ULO8 - Identify and critique emergency nursing resources and strategies to respond to mass casualty events. ULO9 - Outline the purpose and scope of the Australasian Triage Scale.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Discuss the pathophysiological processes underpinning complex disease or injury states. ULO2 - Critically analyse patient assessment findings and prioritise appropriate, age specific, culturally relevant, therapeutic interventions for patients experiencing complex disease or injury states. ULO3 - Review and critique the evidence underpinning complex patient interventions. ULO4 - Plan and execute the assessment and management of a paediatric patient with a complex illness or injury. ULO5 - Apply age specific principles of ventilation in management of a ventilated patient. ULO6 - Demonstrate and evaluate independent triage practice based on the Australasian Triage Scale. ULO7 - Critically evaluate the care of the patient and family in the provision of end of life care and organ donation in the emergency department. ULO8 - Critically evaluate and apply nursing research to selected emergency patient care. ULO9 - Critically evaluate the socio-cultural, legal and ethical issues related to the nursing management of the critically ill patient. ULO10 - Develop and role model the essential elements of leadership and management for emergency nursing.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Locate and critically appraise data to support advanced medical/surgical nursing practice. ULO2 - Synthesise information in order to plan and implement appropriate, evidence-based, person-centred therapeutic interventions for medical and surgical patients experiencing cardiovascular, respiratory and renal dysfunction, and shock. ULO3 - Synthesise information in order to plan and implement appropriate, evidence-based, person-centred therapeutic interventions for medical and surgical patients who experience psychological and behavioural management dysfunction. ULO4 - Plan and implement therapeutic interventions which are age specific and culturally relevant. ULO5 - Demonstrate effective interpersonal skills in caring for patients and their families and working with members of the multi-disciplinary team. ULO6 - Identify the needs of the patient's family and significant others and plan appropriate nursing interventions to address these needs.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Locate and critically appraise data to support advanced medical/surgical nursing practice. ULO3 - Critically evaluate the socio-cultural, legal and ethical issues related to the nursing management of medical and surgical patients. ULO4 - Analyse the application of interpersonal skills in the management of patients, families and significant others who are experiencing grief, loss or what they perceive to be a crisis. ULO5 - Critically analyse the clinical, situational and professional issues supporting and complicating advanced practice in medical and surgical nursing. ULO6 - Critically evaluate approaches to patient safety and clinical risk management.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Personal and professional perspectives in nutrition
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Develop effective communication skills including constructive feedback to peers, reflective writing and self awareness. ULO2 - Describe the diverse work roles for nutrition practice and the professional attitudes and behaviours required to meet workplace expectations. ULO3 - Collaborate in effective teams respecting diversity of opinions and approaches to tasks. ULO4 - Identify key determinants of culture and recognise the potential influence of culture on health behaviour, beliefs and choices. ULO5 - Investigate the foods, food ingredients, historical influences and varied cultural eating patterns found in Australia. ULO6 - Develop a perspective on issues of social equity and justice, demonstrating an awareness of self in relation to diverse and vulnerable populations and as a future nutrition professional.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Interpret the demographics of the Australian population including Indigenous, minority and disadvantaged groups, their nutrition and health issues. ULO2 - Explore the health and nutrition needs of priority population groups in Australia. ULO3 - Evaluate a socio-ecological approach to improving health. ULO4 - Search the scientific literature related to common questions on nutrition and health. ULO5 - Evaluate the scientific literature, including study designs, related to nutrition and health and communicate findings. ULO6 - Design quality research questions on nutrition and health. ULO7 - Identify and apply quantitative statistical analysis using methods common to nutrition research and interpret statistical results. ULO8 - Describe basic methods of qualitative data collection and analysis.

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Explain the process of digestion and absorption of macro and micronutrients and discriminate between their respective role(s) in the human body. ULO2 - Identify foods sources of particular nutrients, and recognise the clinical signs and symptoms of particular nutrient deficiencies and excesses, and explain the reason for their development. ULO3 - Describe basic dietary assessment techniques and discuss the strengths and weaknesses of different methods of assessing food intake when evaluating nutritional status. ULO4 - Explain how food composition data is obtained and discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this data in diet evaluation. ULO5 - State current nutritional recommendations for the general population and apply them to evaluate the adequacy of diets. ULO6 - Recognise the effects that nutrients may have on the absorption and utilization of other nutrients.
