UNIT_TITLE: Translational research: pathways to the clinic
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically evaluate the research literature and evaluate the potential for clinical translation ULO2 - Examine and interpret translational research findings in medicine and communicate these to technical and non-technical audiences ULO3 - Critically evaluate the benefits and drawbacks of different translational research pathways to drug development, commercialisation or clinical trials. ULO4 - Demonstrate the ability to work effectively, either individually or in teams, to present a proposal and develop your leadership skills ULO5 - Identify and evaluate commercial and ethical decision-making crossroads in translational research ULO6 - Identify and apply translational research processes including the drug discovery pipeline, market needs, intellectual property, sourcing funding, company spin-offs and regulatory bodies
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Clinical and translational haematology and immunology
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify the key cells, moleculesand processes that comprise thehaematopoietic and immunesystems ULO2 - Evaluate how the haematopoieticand immune responses areregulated and integrated ULO3 - Recognise the biological processesand therapeutic targets involved indisorders of the haematologic andimmune systems ULO4 - Evaluate appropriate tools andtechniques for therapeuticapplication of disorders of thehaematologic and immune systems ULO5 - Critically appraise the key conceptsand conclusions from translationalhaematological and immunologicalresearch literature ULO6 - Develop a specific researchquestion grounded in a criticalreview of the clinical and scientificliterature related to anhaematological or immunologicaldisease and its current therapies
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify pathogenic genetic and molecular mechanisms involved in specific ULO2 - Evaluate appropriate tools and techniques to investigate specific neurological/ neuropsychiatric disorders and diagnose and predict patient treatment outcomes ULO3 - Critically appraise the key concepts and conclusions from translational neuroscience research literature ULO4 - Develop a specific research question grounded in a critical review of the clinical and scientific literature of neurological/ neuropsychiatric disorders ULO5 - Communicate critical arguments pertaining to a neurological/ neuropsychiatric disorder research question to a professional audience
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
OWNING_ORG_UNIT: Van Cleef Roet Centre for Nervous Diseases

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply knowledge of bioinformatics data exploration and storage using public and private databases ULO2 - Justify the application of bioinformatic research methodologies to visualise translational bioinformatics data ULO3 - Analyse, interpret and appraise bioinformatics research data by applying appropriate bioinformatic research methodologies in translational and clinical research ULO4 - Critically appraise the key concepts and conclusions from translational bioinformatics research literature ULO5 - Communicate and explain the key concepts and conclusions from translational bioinformatics research literature ULO6 - Apply the principles of ethics and privacy to all bioinformatics data analysis and reporting
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Translational research and medicine for metabolic disorders
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify the cells, molecules and pathways involved in metabolism and bioenergetics ULO2 - Distinguish between the epigenetic and genetic basis of metabolic disorders ULO3 - Evaluate the pathogenic molecular and cellular mechanisms contributing to metabolic disorders ULO4 - Evaluate and appraise appropriate tools and techniques to investigate metabolic disorders and predict patient treatment outcomes in metabolic disorders ULO5 - Critically appraise and communicate the key concepts and conclusions from translational metabolic disorder research literature to a professional audience ULO6 - Develop a specific research question grounded in a critical review of the clinical and scientific literature related to metabolic disorders
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_TITLE: Translational research and medicine in blood diseases
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify the key cells, molecules and processes involved in the production of blood and its components ULO2 - Evaluate the pathogenic mechanisms driving haematological diseases ULO3 - Appraise tools and techniques to investigate specific haematological diseases ULO4 - Evaluate appropriate tools and techniques to diagnose and predict patient treatment outcomes in haematological diseases ULO5 - Critically appraise and communicate the key concepts and conclusions from translational haematology research literature to a professional audience ULO6 - Develop a proposed research question grounded in a critical review of the clinical and scientific literature related to haematological diseases and their therapy
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand the basic strategic planning process and components of the strategic plan; ULO2 - Strategically respond to complex problems and develop appropriate planning responses, processes and outcomes relevant to compact cities; ULO3 - Collect, analyse, and interpret community data for strategic planning; ULO4 - Effectively communicate using oral, written, and graphic communication skills; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate capabilities and competencies in ethical approaches to contemporary urban planning; ULO2 - Demonstrate the ability to strategically respond to complex problems and develop appropriate planning responses, processes and outcomes; ULO3 - Demonstrate skills in research, applying creativity and critique to address planning issues; ULO4 - Demonstrate a high level of competence in communication and presentation skills: written, verbal and graphic ones; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_TITLE: Professional practice 1: urban planning and design communication
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand the professional roles and responsibilities of the planner in shaping the built environment; ULO2 - Apply listening, synthesising, graphic, written and verbal communication skills that contribute to the practice of the urban planning professional; ULO3 - Demonstrate an understanding of collaborative processes such as mediation, negotiation and engagement required for effective planning processes with diverse stakeholders; ULO4 - Demonstrate an understanding of the professional ethics required of planners; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_TITLE: Planning study 1: history and theory of planning and urban design
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Identify and describe the historical foundations and major periods of urban planning from the 19th century to today; ULO2 - Identify and describe the key paradigms that define urban planning theory; ULO3 - Develop critical thinking skills that inform professional practice; ULO4 - Effectively communicate using oral, written, and graphic communication skills; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate a command of historical and contemporary approaches to the regulatory contexts shaping planning systems; ULO2 - Demonstrate the ability to research and understand planning principles and frameworks in Australia in a global context; ULO3 - Be able to interpret legal codes and policies and apply them through planning instruments; ULO4 - Have developed an understanding of the complex political environments and the impacts of these on planning cities; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_TITLE: Planning project 3: planning metropolitan growth areas
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate knowledge of metropolitan planning to address the dynamics, determinants, and impacts of urban sprawl; ULO2 - Apply research skills to analyse and address current growth patterns in middle and outer suburbs; ULO3 - Generate alternative urban growth scenarios and model their impacts on the environment, society, and economy; ULO4 - Enable developing design-led solutions to address urban sprawl; ULO5 - Develop professional competence in written, verbal and graphic communication skills; ULO6 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically reflect on and practice ethical approaches to contemporary urban planning in diverse communities; ULO2 - Strategically respond to complex problems and develop appropriate planning responses, processes and outcomes pertinent to social and community planning; ULO3 - Apply skills in research to address social and community planning issues; ULO4 - Communicate in written, verbal and graphic formats on social and community planning issues; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_TITLE: Professional practice 2: analytic methods for urban planning
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand and apply methods commonly employed in planning practice; ULO2 - Apply skills in GIS and statistics to analyse and research planning problems for innovative solutions; ULO3 - Understand the types of data required to analyse a planning problem and data collection methods; ULO4 - Effectively communicate research findings both verbally and visually; ULO5 - Be able to work both independently and as a part of a team.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_TITLE: Planning study 3: economics and the city
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Discuss the historical and contemporary factors that shape urban economies; ULO2 - Analyse and evaluate urban and metropolitan economies; ULO3 - Apply basic knowledge of land economics and conduct feasibility analyses; ULO4 - Evaluate the likely impact of new land use planning controls on urban development; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Critically reflect on and describe key theories and concepts for democratic participation and engagement; ULO2 - Apply a range of engagement techniques in diverse communities, including Indigenous communities; ULO3 - Apply methods to identify the assets, issues, and conflicts of various stakeholders; ULO4 - Effectively communicate community planning concepts and strategies; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_TITLE: Work integrated learning: industry placement experience
UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Perform a variety of urban planning analysis, appraisal, and evaluation tasks within an urban planning and design work environment; ULO2 - Communicate and operate effectively and constructively as a team-member within an urban planning and design project team; ULO3 - Reflect critically upon the operational strengths and weaknesses of project and office management procedures employed within a professional urban planning and design context; ULO4 - Describe the variety of the tasks, problems and approaches that constitute urban planning and design practice; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate the ability to contribute to scholarly debate in Urban Planning and Design; ULO2 - Demonstrate the ability to perform original, independent research; ULO3 - Apply skills in qualitative and/or quantitative research methods; ULO4 - Demonstrate awareness on the ethical implications of research in Urban Planning and Design; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate an understanding of the open web as an interactive medium; ULO2 - Communicate the design of interactive systems that enhance the user experience; ULO3 - Apply user experience design principles to curating meaningful online experiences; ULO4 - Engage with fundamental programming concepts and apply their techniques to create interactive content; ULO5 - Create purposeful and user-centred interactive systems using web technologies; ULO6 - Understand and comply with the OHS requirements of the unit.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand the process of converting visual material into a digital format using scanning and image capturing technology; ULO2 - Understand the types of digital imaging including still graphics, animation and video, 2D and 3D; ULO3 - Understand the composition of the digital image including resolution and compression formats; ULO4 - Demonstrate the skills to manipulate digital images using digital editing software; ULO5 - Demonstrate the skills to create a digital image using digital editing software; ULO6 - Demonstrate awareness of the different digital image formats applicable to different multimedia authoring environments; ULO7 - Understand the process of inclusion of digital images into multimedia authoring environments.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Recognise, analyse and use the elements of design; ULO2 - Understand the role of visual communication and fundamental design principles as applied to Multimedia/New Media; ULO3 - Recognise some of the theoretical and psychological issues of selected colour theories; ULO4 - Understand and apply selected colour theories to digital media; ULO5 - Recognise, analyse and use typography; ULO6 - Express ideas and concepts for multimedia using visual communication forms, drawing, digital imaging, graphic design and typography; and ULO7 - Observe and employ occupational health and safety appropriate to studio practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand the fundamentals of the visual language of Multimedia/New Media design; ULO2 - Understand the design process and the role of visual design within Multimedia/New Media product development; ULO3 - Understand the application of design elements and principles within Multimedia/New Media design; ULO4 - Work with type and image, creating a hierarchy; ULO5 - Create design structures, grids, layout and composition; ULO6 - Understand and apply fundamental concepts of time and motion within Multimedia/New Media design; ULO7 - Effectively communicate design critique and evaluation of Multimedia/New Media products; and ULO8 - Observe and employ occupational health and safety appropriate to studio practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Apply international standards and protocols related to digital media development; ULO2 - Undertake a critical analysis of interactive media communication tools with a view to maximising the effectiveness of UX (User Experience Design); ULO3 - Display an increased technical proficiency across the development, creation and production of digital media, using industry standard software applications in relation to multi-platform media design concepts and standards; ULO4 - Develop solutions that effectively explore software and hardware in terms of information architecture, interaction design, usability, usability testing, quality assurance and maintenance in the application of interactive digital media; ULO5 - Explore a range of approaches to User Experience Design with an increased understanding of processes, practices, methods and techniques for the production of interactive media systems; and ULO6 - Observe and employ occupational health and safety appropriate to studio practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Use a wide range of traditional illustration media confidently at a basic level; ULO2 - Understand the uses and limitations of basic illustration materials on both traditional and experimental levels; ULO3 - Apply the principles of form, shape and composition to the practice of illustration; ULO4 - Understand the use of symbols and other devices that contribute to the communicative power of illustration; ULO5 - Comprehend the historical development of illustration as a persuasive and prevalent public art-form; ULO6 - Begin to comprehend the indisputable link between illustration and the greater practice of graphic design.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Effectively use the elements and principles of design; ULO2 - Understand typographical terminology; ULO3 - Create design structures, grids, layout and composition; ULO4 - Work with texts, creating a hierarchy; ULO5 - Recognise and understand the formal elements of design, such as space, line and texture in relation to type; ULO6 - Produce sophisticated type rendered by hand or generated by computer; ULO7 - Explore experimental typography; ULO8 - Use type to create an emotional and intellectual impact with an understanding of the relationship between type, image and language.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand the breadth of communication elements used within graphic design including metaphor, juxtaposition, parody, wit and humour; ULO2 - Understand the development of modern graphic design and its associated conceptual and intellectual development; ULO3 - Clearly understand the language and grammar of visual communication; ULO4 - Utilise a thorough comprehension of this language in the execution of your own projects; ULO5 - Observe and employ occupational health and safety appropriate to studio practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Use a variety of illustration techniques: traditional, electronic and experimental; ULO2 - Explore the potential for illustration to answer a range of graphic design problems; ULO3 - Apply the principles of composition to the practice of illustration, and its surrounding design elements; ULO4 - Understand the historical development of illustration in the practice of graphic design and comprehend its ability to become the principle visual focus of a major design project; ULO5 - Successfully unite illustration with typography and other essential design elements; ULO6 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Effectively use the elements and principles of design; ULO2 - Create design structures, grids, layout and composition; ULO3 - Work with texts, creating a hierarchy; ULO4 - Examine typography in two and-three dimensions; ULO5 - Produce more sophisticated type rendered by hand or generated by computer; ULO6 - Explore experimental typography; ULO7 - Use type to create an emotional and intellectual impact with an understanding of the relationship between type, image and language; ULO8 - Skilfully and expressively use both informative and artistic modes to create a holistic vision of the world of typography; ULO9 - Demonstrate a greater awareness of the historical development of typography; ULO10 - Examine the relationship between communication and form in relation to typographic practice; ULO11 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate competence in conceptualising, visualising, copywriting and art direction in the context of advertising; ULO2 - Understand and be able to implement research analysis, problem solving, creative teamwork and brief compliance; ULO3 - Engage the imagination toward the ingenious connections between certain products (whether goods or services) and the desires of a given market; ULO4 - Consider ethical questions concerning the persuasive powers of advertising; ULO5 - Understand and be able to apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to the unit of study.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Use image making processes, be it photographic, hand generated or digital, to record an unfamiliar environment; ULO2 - Cohesively plan a sequence of images that narrates a response to this environment; ULO3 - Understand the importance of image as visual communication; ULO4 - Understand the relevance of personal observation and experience in shaping the outcomes of an image; ULO5 - Utilise an overseas experience to mature as a designer and visual communicator; ULO6 - Observe and employ occupational health and safety principles and rules appropriate to studio practice.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand how to create digital fonts using specific design software; ULO2 - Demonstrate a sound knowledge of type construction; ULO3 - Use a computer as an effective design tool; ULO4 - Demonstrate a greater understanding of the importance of type legibility through the design and application of digitally produced fonts; ULO5 - Digitally produce fonts with skill and focused experimentation to a professional standard; ULO6 - Consider research as a strategy to develop and initiate concept development within your practical work.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Draw from your experience through different disciplines in the semester; ULO2 - Develop conceptual solutions to projects set across a range of fine art media; ULO3 - Experiment with production methods of a select array of mediums used in contemporary visual art practices; ULO4 - Apply strategies of observation, analysis and experimentation across the developmental process; ULO5 - Understand interdisciplinary approaches across contemporary visual art practices at both individual and collaborative levels; ULO6 - Contextualise your work and its material rationale within the field of contemporary visual art practices; ULO7 - Understand and apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to sustained independent studio practice and in order to collaborate safely with peers.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Initiate a broad range of conceptual and analytical approaches to projects; ULO2 - Experiment with a variety of materials and technical approaches in relation to emerging research questions; ULO3 - Undertake interdisciplinary, collaborative or curatorial approaches in contemporary visual art practices that are consistent with your emerging research questions; ULO4 - Synthesise strategies of observation, analysis, experimentation and critique within a developmental process where deemed appropriate to respond to various assigned presentation contexts; ULO5 - Contextualise through writing your work and the work of others and its theoretical and material rationale within the field of contemporary visual art; ULO6 - Understand and apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to sustained independent studio practice and in order to collaborate safely with peers.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Understand how the conceptual, material and logistical approaches to your visual artwork relates to gallery-based programs; ULO2 - Examine an area of independently framed research using various analytical strategies; ULO3 - Manage different stages of the development process in an experimental manner; ULO4 - Initiate and present interdisciplinary and collaborative approaches in contemporary visual art practices that are consistent with your consolidating research position; ULO5 - Contextualise through structured writing formats the theoretical and material rationale for your work and the work of others within the field of contemporary visual art; ULO6 - Understand and apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to sustained independent studio practice and in order to collaborate safely with peers.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate self-motivation and able to construct a program of work derived from various workshops that reflect a coherent direction which imaginatively addresses your own concerns; ULO2 - Produce outcomes that display conviction, confidence and control in concepts and materials, or collaborative and curatorial practice and be able to isolate areas of your work that require further research and sustain a directed inquiry into these; ULO3 - Deepen your understanding of current issues in fine art and recognise the potential to produce works within the framework of contemporary culture; ULO4 - Position and contextualise the evaluations of your work and that of other students within the historical and contemporary context and express these observations through a range of outcomes, and; ULO5 - Have increased understanding, and be able to practice, the rules of occupational health and safety in force in the studio, and are able to collaborate and co-operate safely and productively within the studio environment with observance of the OHS&E regulations and policies of the studio.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Demonstrate self-motivation, and able to construct a program of work derived from various workshops that reflect a coherent direction which imaginatively addresses your own concerns; ULO2 - Produce outcomes that display conviction, confidence and control in concepts and materials, or collaborative and curatorial practice and be able to isolate areas of your work that require further research and sustain a directed inquiry into these; ULO3 - Deepen your understanding of current issues in fine art and recognise the potential to produce works or projects within the framework of contemporary culture; ULO4 - Produce outcomes that display advanced skills, confidence and control in theoretical concepts and materials or processes in your work; ULO5 - Approach contemporary art practice and aesthetics with challenge and vigour, and be able to establish a personalised and informed discourse within the context of fine art practice; ULO6 - Achieve a professional presentation and documentation of works in the final submission of your completed work, either practical or curatorial, and; ULO7 - Independently practice the rules of occupational health and safety in force in the studio, and be able to collaborate and co-operate safely and productively within the studio environment with observance of the OHS&E regulations and policies of the studio.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Justify your conceptual, material and logistical approaches to your cultural production in relation to a range of diverse public platforms; ULO2 - Position a critical perspective within a field of research using various analytical strategies appropriate to the presentation and material outcomes of your practice; ULO3 - Devise a self-directed program that identifies different phases of experimentation and consolidation within a field of research; ULO4 - Initiate and present interdisciplinary, collaborative or curatorial approaches in contemporary visual art practices that are consistent with a complex research questions; ULO5 - Contextualise through the creative application of writing the theoretical and material rationale for your work within the field of contemporary cultural production; ULO6 - Understand and apply the rules of occupational health and safety appropriate to sustained independent studio practice and in order to collaborate safely with peers.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture

UNIT_LEARNING_OUTCOME: ULO1 - Compose a self-directed and coherent work plan that addresses advanced research in your field of enquiry; ULO2 - Demonstrate advanced knowledge and skills in techniques, materials and logistics in relation to their production in accordance to questions that emerge out of your cultural research; ULO3 - Critically explore the developmental phase of your research through an advanced engagement in observation, analysis and experimentation; ULO4 - Justify through the creative use and presentation of writing a position in relation to the historical, theoretical and artistic fields your own cultural production sits in; ULO5 - Demonstrate a sophisticated ability to contextualise your cultural practice and the work of others within a curatorial and collaborative rationale in various professional public platforms; ULO6 - Demonstrate the knowledge and ability to achieve safe and sustainable working practices within the studio environment and to independently initiate OHS&E procedures in accordance to their respective work practices.
OWNING_FACULTY: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
